Reviews.Title: “You pay for the location, not the service or quality of the room.”
Reviews.Author: jjhgillam
Reviews.Content: I love staying in Marriotts. I always choose them wherever I travel because I can count on the quality and excellent service they provide. But I would not choose to stay here again, given the opportunity. The hotel's room was quite small and under proportioned for the price I paid to stay there. The staff was friendly and willing to help but when I called to see about a different room I was told that I had accepted the room at check in and there was no reason to move me. I was disapointed when everything in the hotel was a la carte. You would figure in this day and age you would at least get free wireless internet in the room and there wasn't an executive lounge to be found. The business center was nice but I wasn't in the mood to check email at 12 Euro an hour after spending 400 Euro for the night. The location is incredible. The shopping experience you can have in the immediate vacinity is the greatest in all of Paris and you are extremely close to the Metro to go anywhere in Paris. If you don't mind walking, just turn left out the door and walk down to the Louvre or turn right for the Arch de Triumph. But if you are looking for Parisian charm, this is not the right place. Glitzy and gaudy are better descriptions of the surrounding area. For the money there are better places to stay that provide the service afforded at this price range. I would look to stay with them before coming back here. It is a shame because I do generally like Marriotts.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine but for some issues”
Reviews.Author: heehorse
Reviews.Content: First of all, location is excellent, to get that out of the way. Entrance off of the Champs Élysées, impressive lobby if lacking a bit of personality. Service was good except for mixed experience with concierge one of whose only sin was to not seem to care or be interested. Room was good sized for Paris, fixtures and decorations all new and modern for Paris, bed was very comfortable. Two iPod speakers a nice touch. Gym was very small with 1 treadmill 1 elliptical 1 bike and a rack of dumbells, but was empty both times I went - free Evian and fizzy bottled juice was a nice touch. And the issues: initially I was very pleased to find that my room had one of those typical parisian mini-balconies which looked out onto the street behind the hotel (rue de ponthieu I believe). However it turned into a curse when I discovered that there is a nightclub on the ground floor when I was awoken by the clubbing crowd spilling onto the street below my window at 4am screaming and yelling. This continued onto almost 6am. On a Tuesday night. If you stay at this hotel, be advised to avoid the rooms that overlook this street (rooms ending in approximately 30-35 I think). The other notable issue was the lack of clearing room service dishes and other rubbish left outside the rooms in the hallway - I passed the same dirty finished dinner no less than 4 times yesterday. On a business trip I was pretty happy with the hotel, the comfortability of the bed, and the location. The lack of sleep was a major issue though. I would not recommend for those looking for a romantic Paris holiday - the hotel lacks charm, not to mention the gaggle of tech conference attendees who I imagine would also kill the mood if I were there with my wife rather than my work laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: anonymous928
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is definitely the location! You are in the heart of Paris, situated near a key Metro stop and also hop on hop off pick up spots. The room was nice, with a very large bathroom full of amenities. There is also a fitness room that provides free bottled water, soda, and apples. The equipment was sparse, but we never saw anyone else in there so it was not a problem. The lobby is spacious and there were nice touches throughout, including throwbacks to the former purpose of the building - a Louis Vuitton factory. As the food in Paris is very expensive, we chose not to eat in the hotel, but there are numerous eateries in the surrounding area. We also went to a local supermarket one night, which provided a pleasant meal in the room away from the hustle and bustle of the city. There are doormen stationed outside the hotel, but they never once greeted us or even cracked a smile. Perhaps they are just there for security and not customer service. The only other glitch encountered during our stay was the extremely late turn down service. The first night, we were exhausted from jetlag and sightseeing and we were already asleep when they knocked on the door at nearly 10. They did not identify themselves, and when I said we didn't want anything it took a while for them to go away. We were prepared the rest of the nights, as service continued to be provided around that time. The main draw of this hotel is definitely the location, and I think that is what you pay for. The price is certainly not indicative of customer service or anything else extraordinary that one might expect.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely An All Time Favorite”
Reviews.Author: BhamJulie
Reviews.Content: I have only fabulous comments to make about this Marriott. Perfect location, very close to Metro Line 1 FDR stop. The staff were alway extremely helpful and kind. Room turn down service at night, very clean rooms. We requested an interior room due to other reviews and that was a wise choice. We had the breakfast buffet every morning ( I think it's free for many Marriott Rewards Members) and of course that was wonderful as well. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: PedroWM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the middle of "Avenue des Champs-Elysées" and has its own parking with direct access to the hotel. So the location couldn't be better in Paris. The lobby is particularly beautiful and the service was flawless all the way. The room was spacious, with a great bed and with iPod connector. The room service quality was also of high standard. The breaskfast was also amazing. The only thing I would point out is not having free-wifi these days. Definitely a hotel to stay in and come back if you love Paris, as I do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service you expect from Marriott”
Reviews.Author: chgotrvlr71
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for five nights while on a European vacation. The hotel has a great location right on the Champs Ã‰lysÃ©es. I had an upgraded room which was quite spacious with separate sitting area. The only complaint about the room itself was that it overlooked the lobby courtyard. Despite this, the room was amazingly quiet just never wanted to open curtains as people in the lobby could definitely see into the room. As a Marriott Rewards member, we had free Internet and full morning breakfast buffet which was quite tasty. Concierge was well-informed and helpful. Room service was efficient and tasty with many options, even in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for "First Timers"!”
Reviews.Author: jerrycoin
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to go to Paris for your "First Time", this is a wonderful place. The only hotel on the C-E and when you go onto the C-E from the hotel, it's like walking into a "Movie set". The hotel staff is flawless in their attention to detail, and the activity you can walk to is wonderful. If you want to be a tourist, this is the place to be. Now one should realize this is an expensive hotel, but if you are only going once, this is the place! They have a great sidewalk cafe, and your ability to enjoy the plentiful dining all around you is wonderful. They also have a wonderful dining agenda, and the "Eggs Benedict" are the finest I have ever had! You can get there from CDG very easily on the RER, and then taking the Metro, it will save you a lot of money. Enjoy one special place!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: mandyb64
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent the weekend in Paris and stayed at the Marriott Champs-Elysees. It's many, many years since either of us have been to Paris and we were initially a little apprehensive given the reputation of the city for being unfriendly (I acknowledge that we live in London, which can be equally unfriendly!). We were thrilled to be proved wrong. The staff at the hotel could not have been more attentive, helpful and polite. Actually, we were treated extremely well by everyone that we encountered during the weekend. Even the Metro staff went out of their way to be helpful; a system which, I would suggest, could be a little daunting if it's something that you're not used to. That said, the numbering of the routes is really simple and easy to use one you've figured out which direction you're heading in. The hotel is in a good location, with handy access to the Metro. If you can get away with not using it, I would do so as you will gain so much from wandering around the city on foot and there really are some hidden gems down the little side streets. The hotel was also extremely accommodating as we arrived particularly early, not expecting to be able to check in, but we were able to do so. We can't commend the staff here highly enough. If your time in Paris is limited, I would recommend the Marais district for mooching around; and eating too. Also, it was suggested to us that we should walk down the Rue du Faubourg St Honore as opposed to the Champs-Elysees, which we would endorse. A fabulous city. We won't leave it so long before visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott je t'aime!”
Reviews.Author: Slavomir B
Reviews.Content: I am from Russia and travel everywhere around the world with my family. I think that this is one of my favorite hotels. The staff ar very nice and help you with everything. One man speaks great Russian and others try hard. The location is greatest, never find any better - it isn't possible! My advice is to stay here. Shopping is here, nightime everything is near by. The hotel's food was very very good. Eat the sole fish, it was the best we had in Paris, better than the expensive restaurants! Concierge very helpful also.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful, romantic stay. Best Paris Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: surfinginflorida
Reviews.Content: When we were choosing which Marriott to stay in Paris, we had a hard time choosing between this one and the Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe, so we stayed at both. In this review I will compare the two because Iâ€™m sure many travelers are faced with the same decision. Check-in: We tried to get early check-in to both the Paris Marriott Champs Elysees Hotel (Marriott) and the Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe (Renaissance). In both cases, we had to wait for our room because they were getting special rooms available for us (overlooking the Champs Elysees at the Marriott, and a room with a curved window at the Renaissance). No problem, we left our luggage and explored Paris. When we returned (in both cases around 6:00), we were not in the premium rooms promised at either hotel! The rooms were nice; they just faced the courtyard instead. At the Marriott, our luggage was in the room, along with a welcome gift (1/2 bottle of wine, bottle of water and desserts) and our Marriott Rewards gift (1/2 bottle of wine and a fabulous cheese platter). At the Renaissance, we had a welcome gift (bottle of wine and some fishy-tasting crackers) but had to wait for our luggage and rewards gift. Rooms: Both rooms were nice, a little on the small side and comparable with amenities. The Marriott was elegant, with a nice garden tub and separate shower. The furnishings were elegant, the bed was not as comfortable -- it felt like there was quilt serving as a pillow-top on top of the mattress. The Renaissance was understated luxury -- more trendy furniture but a very comfortable bed. The bathroom did not have a tub, but had a nice rain shower head. The Renaissance was cleaner. Service: I didnâ€™t think there was any comparison in service. At the Marriott, you would never touch a door â€“ the bellmen/doormen were extremely attentive and helpful. The front desk and concierge were also great â€“ and it was nice to have our luggage taken to our room without request. My husband is a platinum Marriott member, and after reading the reviews of the Renaissance, we were very disappointed with our service. The front desk was great, but that was the extent. We would come home at night, and rather than opening the door, the bellman just stared at us (I thought he was a security guard trying to act hard). It took over two hours to get a bottle of wine that we were promised would be delivered in five minutes. Unless we greeted the reception area personnel first, we werenâ€™t acknowledged. Not typical for a Marriott, being French isnâ€™t a good excuse. Location: Marriott is in a better location. There were several homeless people sleeping on the grates near the Renaissance. Restaurant: Breakfast was much better at the Marriott, as was the service. The Marriott was relaxing and bright and cheerful. The Renaissance was more suited for the evening, and the morning servers acted like they had a late evening out. If I went back to Paris, I would choose the Paris Marriott Champs Elysees Hotel over the Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe. Even though the Renaissance bed was more comfortable and I enjoyed the trendier atmosphere, service is #1 and the Renaissance just wasnâ€™t there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dapger
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel using my points. Nice hotel but I was expecting more out of a 5 star. The room was nice and clean with two queen beds. Peaceful and quite large for Paris. The heat went out and they tried to fix it. The guy came in the room and went straight to the window to see if it was closed. Needless to say I wanted to knock him in the head. They were not able to fix it and we were out most of the day and were too warn out to move to an additional room that was available. They brought us a bottle of wine to keep us warm and we had a good laugh at that. With extra blankets we were fine. The hotel is located close to the metro and all the shopping. If you want easy this is a great place to stay. If you want to feel Paris I would suggest a few places around the corner that are more intimate. But the truth is anywhere in Paris is great as long as you are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Paris for a day or two”
Reviews.Author: Traveler260
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Paris for 3 days 2 nights on my way to Italy. I found the architecture beautiful! A very clean and safe environment. Going to the top of the Eiffel Tower is a must! Go outside the tourist attractions to sample some true parisan fare!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: hooah
Reviews.Content: I agree with all most all of the reveiws mainly the GREAT ONES!!This is a wonderful hotel.My girlfriend and I stayed there for 2 nites after a river cruise in mid Dec.You can't beat Paris at Chritmas time with a huge Christmas market 3 blocks from the hotel.We went to and climbed the Arc de triomphe,a must do,and ate at several nice resterants within walking distance of the hotel.The property itself is wonderful and right on the Champs-Elysees that in itself is something to behold!The staff couldn't have been better,friendly and professional.We had a ton of questions and the Guest Service lady answred them all including getting us our boarding passes for our departure flight.A bit pricey but all of Paris is that way.

Reviews.Title: “hotel in the middle of the Champs-Elysees”
Reviews.Author: alghannam
Reviews.Content: The hotel located in the middle of the Champs-Elysees, a street full of attractions and activities , coffee shops and stores Most of the rooms has no good view, only facing the nearing building , some rooms face the lobby , the lobby is relatively small, rooms are in good size, room service is extremely expensive , breakfast is good with some selection of food, other restaurant at the hotel are not special, the bar is in the middle of the lobby , wi-fi is chargeable , room rate are expensive due to its location in the middle of chapes elyees, but you could find other hotel in a very close distant to the chaps , with a reasonable price You have to be carful that the store on the chaps are very expensive too

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: PatrickDebus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well-located on the famous Champs-ElysÃ©e, very closed to the well-known "Fouquet's" and "Lido". The room (#715) was less confortable and luxuous than the usual level of what you can expect from Marriott, especiallt taling in consideration of the rate (you mainly pay for the location): however, good level and clean, but no more... Very professional staff and high safety (security to enter in the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Merveilleux!”
Reviews.Author: Tricycle825
Reviews.Content: I too, was a little unsure if I wanted to stay in the hub of activity vs. the quiet of a different location. Having now stayed in the 1st and the 8th ... the Champs Elysees is the place to be at least during Christmas - NYE week. Stores are open very late and the Christmas markets are close by offering vin chaud (hot wine) to take the chill out of an evening stroll. The hotel itself was superb. No complaints. We arrived very early and they did try to accomodate our arrival even at the early hour on a busy week. They were able to get us situated into a lovely room within 2 hours of arrival (I sense we could have had a room sooner, but they were trying to get us an upgraded room) - and during that time we were offered a complimentary breakfast (perhaps due to platinum status, perhaps due to just a great staff). It happened to be a beautiful day so they stored our bags and personal belongings and we walked around the area. Upon return, our room did not disappoint, large by european standards with a small balcony overlooking a courtyard. From the balcony you could see Sacre Couer. It was very quiet and having a door to the outside that could open made sleeping (even in December) enjoyable ... and yes, the beds lived up to Marriott standards. Breakfast was enjoyed each morning --- always greeted by Hana (and she was missed on her days off!). The breakfast was very complete and a great way to start the day of touring. Nightly turndown service always left fresh towels, chocolates (albeit Godiva) and water. NYE was welcomed in by the complimentary split of champagne left by the management. This is just a sampling of the touches extended by the management of this hotel. Definitely recommended for business AND pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay..nice staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: RWH03
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on line and had some second thoughts about staying here. But the hotel was a great place. The staff was excellent, especially the concierge and bell staff. The rooms were generous and we had a view of the city. The food and services are expensive but we found all of Paris to be the same. The concierge had detailed instructions on how to get places and we followed them. We didn't find any rudeness amongst the staff, despite what other reviews have said. The location is great. Convenient to the metro and you can walk to many places as well..just get out your walking shoes though. Enjoy Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Address in the heart of the action”
Reviews.Author: LikeCouchakji
Reviews.Content: There's no better feeling than, after a long walk window shopping through the strrets of Faubourg Saint Honore, Avenue Georges V and Avenue de Montaigne you end up throwing yourself on on one of the comfortable fauteuils in the lobby of the Marriotts on the Champs Elysees. This hotel has always been my favourite 1- because of the excellent service I get there plus the sparkling clean rooms and 2- because of its emplacement at the heart of Paris. To eat no need to be fancy, you can have very good food prepared in a casual atmosphere by their talented Chef JÃ©rÃ©my Touzelet at "Le Restaurant"

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Great location, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TeriTravels74
Reviews.Content: Wow - what a great location, easy to walk just about everywhere if you enjoy seeing new cities by foot. We walked from our hotel to the Eiffle tower, the Louvre, Sainte Chappelle, Notre Dame, & the Arc de Triomphe (to name a few.) The staff was really friendly - we found everyone in Paris to be very friendly. I am American, I think you get what you give. We were upgraded to a great two room suite facing the Champs-Elysees and had a great view of the Arc de Triomphe. (This was due to being Platinum w/ Marriott.) The restaurant was great, enjoyed trying new food. Paris isn't inexpensive of course, as an example I ordered a glass of Champagne in the hotel lobby and it was $25 - came with strawberries, raspberries, and a little bowl of nuts...and it was great champagne....but that's Paris. Be prepared for the prices and you'll enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: I liked this place. The staff were friendly and attentive, my room was great and the restaurant was better than I expected. Great lady in charge of the Reception and friendly girl greeting you at breakfast. So far, best location and the least snooty service I've had in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not so good rooms”
Reviews.Author: rata_200
Reviews.Content: The best aspect of the hotel is its location, right on Champs Elysees. The lobby, restaurant and bar areas are really nice and upscale. The rooms are very small with standard Marriott decoration. Very few rooms have outside views, most of them face the indoor atrium/ lobby making them dark and giving you an enclosed feeling. Service was the same as every Marriott, good but not great. Stay hear if you want to be right on Champs-Elysees but if you can extend your budget go to the George V, the Meurice or the Plaza Athenee. I stayed at this property during 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Maxine3618
Reviews.Content: I only stayed two nights because I only went to Paris to see an art exhibit at The Grand Palais. I chose this hotel because it was within walking distance. I used my Marriott reward points and because I am Gold our room was upgraded and breakfast was included. The hotel does not have an executive lounge. Because we were there on Christmas eve we were surprised to see a tray with 12 gifts of Christmas waiting for us in our room, there was chocolates, raisins, apples, oranges, clementines, lichee nuts etc. The staff was friendly and nice. Throughly enjoyed my short weekend in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Marriotts anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: RAM222
Reviews.Content: We stayed here December 21-28, 2011 â€œChristmas in Parisâ€�!!! Paris is wonderful any time, but at Christmas it is transformed into a true City of Lights with the holiday light displays! Walk out the front door and you are on the famous Champs-Elysees, and what an experience especially on Christmas night (it was like Mardi Gras in New Orleans without the drunks!). This is an elegant and classy hotel meeting highest Marriott standards but with exceptional French service. We did not meet a single staff member that wasnâ€™t friendly or helpful. The pianist playing the lobby piano could play in any venue I have attended - simply outstanding â€“ with a broad repertoire of Christmas carols, classical, contemporary, traditional and pop music (she was one of the highlights of our trip!) Full breakfast buffet was good and presented good variety. We arrived around 9:00 AM and the front desk got us checked right into our room (we had requested, but did not expect, an early check-in). Concierge was very helpful and assisted us with our restaurant reservations and advice. The rooms were very clean and bedding was typical Marriott (excellent). The hotel is located in a very convenient location, near two metro stations and one RER train station, and during good weather within easy walking distance of the Arch de Triumph, Place de la Concorde, Eiffel Tower, Place Vendome, the Golden Triangle (all less than a mile). Best of all the hotel was very quiet at night (stay in the back of the hotel if you can). We will stay here again. . .

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: Pierre S
Reviews.Content: I have to say they did a great job! We arrived early and they fed us breakfast while they prepared our rooms. It was a great breakfast. There was a girl named Hana at Breakfast and she was simply magical! Everyone was so nice to us (had I gone abroad???) Then when we go to our rooms, we had the most magically unique view of the Champs Elysees! It was so special that I couldn't believe it...I was on a terrasse over the avenue. I think that if you are like us, and only visit Paris now and then, you must stay where in the heart of France. We could see la Tour Eiffel and l'Arc de Triomphe and Place de la Concorde! You must stay here! We had great food (becase the restaurants around the Champs Elysees are over-priced and not really for good French cuisine and the hotel served very good French food!). They ahd very amicable staff, a super big and great bed BUT the absolutely BEST location in the world.

Reviews.Title: “I love Paris and the Marriott in Paris too!”
Reviews.Author: PatSnyder
Reviews.Content: Paris is wonderful any time of the year, but at Christmas, this City of Lights takes on a new meaning! Just outside the door of this Paris Marriott, the Champs-Elysees is brimming in bright blue holiday lights, making it seem even more like a dreamlike fantasy. This is an elegant and classy hotel, which you feel from the moment you enter the front door. The rooms are a decent size, even for those on a budget, using Marriott points! There is a live piano in the lobby, as well as a magnificent display of flowers. It's a great place to hang your Parisian hat.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in spring...”
Reviews.Author: LadyGuzman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while traveling w/ a family as a nanny. We arrived before our check in time and after a 9+ hour flight with a 1 year old, we were ready to rest and drop off luggage. They got us in early with no problem. We stayed in a room overlooking the lobby and there was never an issue with noise. Internet reception was great. Concierge was very kind...helped us locate grocery store for milk and playgrounds nearby. Had no clue they could change currency for us which came in handy when the atm across the street decided to eat our debit card while attempting to check our balance. Room was clean and never had issues with it being too hot or cold. Street is very busy, but if you live in any major city it isn't that overwhelming. Very close to landmarks and great shopping (if you can afford it!). The breakfast was very good...a little overpriced but yummy none the less. Loved staying here. While I did give them a 'poor' in kids activities, I'm sure if they had some sort of activity happening we would have been too young to participate. Climbing stairs and playing in the lobby worked just fine! If you can't survive without a Starbucks or fast food joints, there are plenty nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good location”
Reviews.Author: victoria_adams
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our anniversary weekend over 4th December and had a fabulous time. Located on the Champs Elysee most of the main sites are within walking distance and although the entrance has an escalator the door men were always very welcoming and helpful. Concierge secured us great seats at the Lido although we failed to get to the Moulin Rouge the Lido was great too. We managed to spill water on the bed and when we got back it was all remade and clean again which was really good. We only had breakfast in the hotel which was a little typically buffet with not much flourish but just being a bit picky now!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Harma
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife at the Marriott Champs-Elysees in November 2011 for 5 nights. The hotel was wonderful. Our room had a small balcony with a nice view of Montmartre. The rooms were clean and typical of a Marriott. The hotel is located in a very convenient location, near two metro stations and one RER train station. It is a walking distance to the LIDO and to Crazy Horse. The Lobby is very nice with a decent restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: bamNorthEast
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a second stay at the Paris Marriott Hotel in the Champs Elysees and it was just as good this time around! Quite apart from the fantastic location, this is a stunning hotel with excellent service from staff who can't do enough for you - great at any time but particularly in a city which is not always renowned for its friendliness. Food was amazing (dare I say better than some of the top restaurants we visited!) and the rooms are elegant and spacious. We were lucky enough to have one with a view over the Champs Elysees which made it just magical. Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Marina B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott 5 nights so we really got see how the Hotel works. It was first class all the way from the buffet breakfast to turn down with chocolates and Evian water in the evening. Located on the hustle and bustle of the Champs Elysees, it was close to 3 metro stops, cafes and shops. Surprisingly it was very quiet inside. We loved staying there, and on our last day at breakfast hugged the breakfast staff who we had got to know so well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Marriott at the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: passiontravel9
Reviews.Content: This is really a very nice Marriott, and really loved the location......but then there is much more to it than just the location. Good service....clean and for Paris standards large rooms and some really very nice quality of breakfasts in the morning, specially the eggs made to order were really done in wonderful french high cooking ways and the service at the restaurant was just fantastic. They really pamper the guests at this hotel with high quality loccitain amenities....which are really great...the bathrooms are really big, both with a large shower space and a seperate Tub and large sink area too. The only thing this hotel could improve on is the frond desk check in experience but to their defence only at check in and after that on a daily basis if one has to deal with the front desk then they are nice. The concierage service is very good and always ready to help you out with all that you need to explore this wonderful city which we visited after about 20 years. Would definately stay here again and add breakfast to your rate if possible.

Reviews.Title: “"Average" might be generous.”
Reviews.Author: gambu50
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 star hotel, a category 8 within Marriott's system and very pricey. One would expect a first class experience. Good luck. My wife and I stayed in 2 different types of rooms. The first was a larger, more expensive room. Although it was decent size by Paris standards, it was packed with so much furniture that there wasn't room for our luggage. It seemed like we were navigating around furniture with every move. In the end, it had the feel of a very small room, with a very high price. The worst part, however, was the noise. The room was right above a restaurant and lounge area with an outdoor patio that played music well into the early morning hours. It wasn't horribly loud, but it's hard to go to sleep, and stay asleep, with a driving beat in the background. After three attempts to move to a quieter room, we were transferred to a room without the pulsating sounds of the restaurant and lounge. Unfortunately, it was tiny and had its own unique noise problems - thin walls that allowed us to hear every word of the hour long argument going on at 1 a.m. in the adjoining room. Worse yet, there was no price adjustment upon moving to the smaller room since we had requested the change. Then there was the "service". The doormen propped the front door open so they wouldn't have to look at the guests coming and going, let alone actually open the door or offer a greeting. They were responsive when you needed a service that involved a tip, but that's it. The front desk staff was professional, but distant and cool. Management was uncooperative regarding the room change. Certainly not a warm, customer oriented place. If you like Marriott brand properties, there is another alternative very close by that offers much better rooms and service at a more reasonable price. If you care to venture beyond the the Marriott brands, there are lots of better options for the money. If you want to say you stayed at the Marriott Champs-Elysees, good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Not so much!”
Reviews.Author: Pat M
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location for touring Paris. Terrific bathroom, with separate shower. Beyond that if you want a preview of this hotel go to any US Marriott. In fact, the service I have received in Philadelphia, Chicago, DC, and New York was far superior. We had to change rooms due to noise issues (not traffic) and not once did we hear anything like an apology. 20 Euros per day for Internet connection was ridiculous. Can't wait to return to Paris - but will find a better hotel option. November turned out to be a great time to tour - cool, but nice and the crowds were not a problem anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Angeline13
Reviews.Content: Part of the reason we would not stay here again was the location. I thought staying on the Champs Elysees would be great. But it was SO crowded. The traffic on the street was bumper to bumper so getting a cab (even with they help of the Marriott employee) was impossible. I think it would have been better if we had gone during a less busy time (not sure when that is). We had booked two rooms. We arrived after 6pm and only one of our rooms was ready.Our first room reeked of smoke (it was a non smoking room) so they had to give us another one which took awhile. What was troublesome was that there were no apologies for the fact that at 7pm (when check in was at 4) we did not have a single room. No offer to have a complimentary drink while we wait. Nothing. We went to dinner and came back a few hours later and finally our rooms were ready. So, rooms are finally ready. Our room is great. The kids room in on the first floor and is one of the two story rooms that other reviewers have talked about. If you are a light sleeper, avoid this room at all costs. It looks quaint but it was awful for the kids because of the noise from the local nightclubs below. We had the breakfast buffet each morning and it was fantastic. Really impressive variety of fresh fruits, juices and baked goods. We are loyal Marriott fans but this one fell far short of our expectations, especially for how much the rooms are. Next time we will find a hotel that is not in such a prime location...just our personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central Paris location and fabulous breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Washingtonianwoman
Reviews.Content: My second visit to this hotel and my room this time was even nicer than the first visit a few years ago. I like this hotel because it is very well located, has its own underground parking garage, offers quite spacious bedrooms and has a fabulous breakfast. We arrived in the early afternoon to check in and our room was not ready so the lady at check in invited us to sit in the reception area (which is huge) and have anything we wanted from the bar. We declined the offer of a bottle of champagne (silly me) and had 2 glasses of wine instead. Our room faced inwards and was very quiet. If you want a view then ask for one but it will likely be noisier than the inward facing rooms. Also if you are a Marriott premium member there is no concierge lounge at this hotel for you to use.

Reviews.Title: “Should be better for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: memch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the best possible location if you want to be on champs. Rooms are nice enough. But the price is very high which makes one expect more of a premium service than your average 5 star marriott. Bathrooms should be redone, congierge had very some bad restaurant recommendations and room cleaning was not what i expected. There are much better options just a few blocks away for the amount you pay.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, nice room by parisian stds.”
Reviews.Author: chennaitraveller_11
Reviews.Content: great location, bang in the middle of champselysees. ideal for shoppers.. very close to the subwaystation. very nice room, good breakfast. overall price is high but guess ok for mainland europe.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: great location, rather expensive, but overall definately a place to return to. The rooms are quite large for parisian standards and breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lronn H
Reviews.Content: Tool the family to Paris. The Marriott did not disappoint. Very helpful staff, great service. The gentleman that runs the bar in the evenings (Joseph I believe) is great. Had a great room in a quiet part ofthe hotel. All in all highly recommended. It is, however pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty close to the 'perfect hotel'”
Reviews.Author: Cameron06820
Reviews.Content: A fabulous property, well located with tremendous amenities and service. But with a rack rate pushing 950 Euro's, this lovely hotel is worth it only if you can stay using points.

Reviews.Title: “Icing on the valentines day proposal cake”
Reviews.Author: ChrisReay
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Hotel is located right on the Champs-Elysees This Hotel is excellent from the minute we arrived we were greeted to a warm welcome. The Marriott is easy to connect up with any sight seeing events. The Marriott hotels were of the highest standards and the hotel bed were unbelievable comfortable trust me once you lay on them its hard to prize yourself away. At Â£300 a night this hotel really was worth every British Penny and really set the mood for the whole occasion. Thanks for an excellent stay and making night that more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not a Category 8”
Reviews.Author: Sevenfortyfive
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in October. It's location is nice, just a block fom Arc de Triomphe, and plenty of shopping and restaurants. The staff was very helpful and courteous. There is a small number of rooms that face Champs Ã‰lysÃ©es, maybe 8 or so I think. We did not get one. I tried to throw my Platinum Marriott weight around, and did get free Internet and breakfast. Concierge staff was really good, exactly what you would expect. Food and drink in the hotel was very over priced. One morning I waited in the lobby for my wife and had a Pepsi ...... 8 euros! I would say this is a category 6 hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: Eva S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the Champs-Elysees which is great most of the time. It is not so great during rush hour, the taxi drivers complain about the grid lock. I never tried the breakfast buffet. Room service coffee was $10.50, ouch. . . . Also, just like the previous reviewer, my room was entered by a stranger. I yelled and screamed and the person left. If I did not have a hallway in the room, this could have been very unpleasant. My 600 euro room was very small. There was 18 inches between my queen size bed and the TV cabinet.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about service, and it's superb.”
Reviews.Author: coldhluke
Reviews.Content: I am a silver member just checked out after 5 nights stay, and this hotel cares about customer service, I had 3 staff Gonzague, Victor and Sabie took good care of our visit. I have no hesitation to give a hi-five. It's a bit pricey, but definitely a 5-Star hotel in Paris. No, it's not noisy, because rooms have good quality windows and doors facing busy street.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Kozlik700
Reviews.Content: A once in a lifetime stay. We had a room over the Avenue, how amazing can it get! I want to come back and I'm still here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_Adkins
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel twice. The location, on the Champs-Elysees, is perfect. The service is good (great if you consider that much of Paris has poor customer service). And the facility is very nice. The hotel is expensive by Marriott standards, but I will willingly pay the price.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: pfmMa
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice Marriott property in a superb location on the Champs Elysees. Good size room and a spacious bathroom with all the amenities you would expect. Plenty of closet and drawer space and seating. We arrivied early from an overnight flight and our room was made available to us by noon. The room was clean and quiet overlooking a courtyard, which we requested as we did not wish to hear the noise from the street. Except for the doormen who don't acknowledge or look at you, every one was very pleasant and helpful. They have complimentary tea and coffee in the lobby each morning. Our first morning I woke up very early not having adjusted to the time difference and went down for coffee at 6:00 AM. Enjoying a cup in the lovely lobby, an employee greeted me and asked if I would like a newspaper to read. Turn down service was at 9:30 each night, (used to around 6:00 back home), and consisted of bottled water and Godiva chocolates. All these things were nice, but the location on the Champs Elysees is premier. Just steps away from shops, restaurants, the metro, the hop on hop off bus and sightseeing. Ideal as far as we were concerned. The location added greatly to the quality of our time in Paris with everything being so convenient and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Good but certainly a 4 star not 5”
Reviews.Author: Kerjner
Reviews.Content: MY REVIEW IS BASED ON MY OVERALL STAY. PLEASE DO READ MY SECURITY ISSUE AT THIS HOTEL AT THE END OF MY REVIEW. My wife and I spent 5 nights at the Marriott Champs-Elysees. The hotel itself is nice but not amazing by any 5 star standards. It's a pretty regular high end Marriott but nothing like a Four Seasons. If you picture 4 star then you will like it. The rooms are large for a Paris hotel and the location is great. It's right in the middle of all the action on the the Champs-Elysees. Metros are VERY close (1-2 minute) walk. From these close Metro hubs you can quickly get to Eiffle Tower, Marseilles, Louvre and all other attractions. As others have mentioned breakfast is really quite good and large. You do get what you pay for at 29 euros. Amazing shopping and restaurants are just outside the door of the hotel. One thing I didn't like about the hotel is that at a 5 star level I didn't like the nickel and diming for something as basic as wifi. They charge 8 euros an hour OR 19 euros a day for internet access. I thought that doesn't make sense for an $899 a night hotel. Best Western which is 2 star is offering it free as is 99% of most hotels in the area. The hotel does have parking at 40 euros a day. Steep but what the heck it's central Paris so everything is over the top. MAJOR SECURITY COMPLAINT: On our last night we had a random guy from the hotel walk in to our room unannounced at 11:10 PM with a black bag. HE DID NOT KNOCK. We had to chase him from our room and down the hallway. We are convinced he was stealing from rooms because of the way he entered and the way he left. He was VERY surprised to see us in our room. I notified the front desk immediately of this altercation and they said they would address it and i never heard back. I'm still bothered by this experience. I feel lucky we weren't gone or sleeping when he came in. It was NOT handled professionally and properly for the security risk it poses. IF YOU HAVE PASSPORTS ETC. USE THE SAFE.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast, slightly better than average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Nuristanoply
Reviews.Content: I spent nine days at the Champs-Elysees hotel. It is just like most high end Marriotts anywhere in the World. I have stayed a lot nicer hotels for a lot less money. I will say that the location of this hotel makes up for any criticism I can muster. You are in the heart of this glorious city and are a short walk to some breathtaking sights. You are so close to great shopping venues, terrific restaurants, and historic sights. The breakfast is substantial. If a large breakfast is your thing, EAT at the hotel. Yes. It is wonderful and worth the price. If you don't go for the large breakfast, you are less than a minute from any number of cafes that will serve you a delicious croissant and coffee. The rooms are large and comfortable. The bathrooms are made for relaxing. Oh, and turn down service leaves you a slight different treat each night. The hotel has a good WIFI connection. Keep in mind that the hotel is in the heart of Paris so don't expect it to be as quiet as a Mountain Chateau in the Alps, but it is peaceful for the most part. Like with most Marriotts, the staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel--excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Paul W
Reviews.Content: My hotel room was much bigger than average (especially for a European hotel). Unfortunately I was sick for most of the trip, but the staff took great care of me (even offering to bring me aspirin). The location was fantastic with so many iconic landmarks within walking distance. I just wish I hadn't been sick so that I could take advantage of it. The one night I could go out, my buddy and I got the name of a bar from the front desk, and we had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Location..Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: girishnks
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to have enough Marriott points to exchange for a couple of days stay here else it would have been overly pricey...the location of this hotel is awesome...bang in the middle of champs de elysee which is the life of Paris...and close to so many sights...the room that I stayed in was a sort of duplex room..very comfortable...the service was great..all in all...highly recommended...would not be able to advise on value for money as i did not fully pay for the room given it was a redemption of points...

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes You Don't Want to Have to Think ...”
Reviews.Author: Shetraveler
Reviews.Content: I wanted to hate this property, only for the simple reason that it's smack-dab in tourist central, right on the Champs Elysee. I wanted to hate the fact that it's a western-style hotel, catering mostly to business travelers and the elite. And I wanted to hate the fact that I could never afford to pay to stay here ... luckily, I had banked enough Marriott points to get two free nights. But, as I said, sometimes you don't want to have to think, especially after flying all night. When we showed up at 11 am in the morning, we were greeted cheerily by our hotel receptionist who informed us that our room was ready (5 hours before scheduled check-in time!). I got a hearty thank you for being a Marriott Silver member, and was treated no differently for paying for a room with pints, instead of cash. she also reminded me that the concierge could arrange for tours, restaurants, and shuttles (and Indeed I did need a shuttle 2 days later to the other Marriott property out by Disney) ... so, I got the shuttle reservation out for the way. The room was wonderful in the way that the US chain hotels are ... lots of space, down comforters, large bathroom and AC. We even had a tiny terrace from which I could see Sacre Coeur. Everytime we left our room and walked through the atrium lobby, we were greeted with smiles and nods. The service is unparalleled. When my husband lost his glasses, they offered to call the 2 restaurants were last at to check to see if they were there! All the things I wanted to hate the hotel for, I ended up appreciating ... the location, the professionalism, and the most democratic (or in this case, royal) treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: remerton
Reviews.Content: Great full-service Marriott experience in a great location. My wife & 2 teen daughters enjoyed the shopping. I liked being within walking distance of everything we wanted to see. The hop on-hop off tour bus lines are right outside the hotel and there are plenty of cafes along the street for you to explore. The Arc is right down the street. The concierge did a great job of assisting with last minute tour details.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in a lovely city!”
Reviews.Author: AdelePh
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to Paris to celebrate my birthday this year and opted to stay at this beautiful hotel for our stay in Paris. It was the perfect decision! I have been to Paris before but I must admit, staying at the Paris Marriott made it even more special! The location was perfect. It was close to everything and you can pretty much walk to most places easily. There are many train stations around nearby as well. So if you wish to train it instead, it is right near the hotel as well. There are heaps of good places to eat nearby and one of my favourite restaurant, L'atelier de Joel Robuchon is only a few blocks away. The famous Laduree, world famous for their macaroons is pretty much just opposite the hotel. So that was another bonus. If you are into shopping, there are many big designer shops around nearby or you can walk about 15 mins or so to the big shopping place, Galeries Lafayette. The hotel itself is gorgeous! My boyfriend booked us a beautiful room, with our bed itself separated from the wardrobe areas and this large sitting area. Where our bed was it was on an elevated floor and has a beautiful balcony that opens up to beautiful Paris streets. It was so lovely. Because it was my birthday, the hotel also had two bottles of champaign chilled and ready for us to enjoy when we got there. There was also a cake and a card personally signed and addressed to me. It was sweet and a nice touch. I am certain though that my boyfriend did a lot to organised with the hotel to make it as perfect as it was! The staff at the hotel was friendly and attentive. The hotel itself is clean and looks great and so was the room. They also have a turned down service every night with one milk and one dark Godiva chocolate placed on our pillow each night. Our rates included breakfast and the breakfast selection was great. You can also order eggs cooked to your preference. We did not have dinner at restaurants in the hotel so I cannot comment on that. If budget allows, I definitely would recommend this place to everyone that wants to have a great memorable time in Paris. This hotel is simply stunning and perfect in so many ways. And if you want to enjoy the Eiffel Tower, make sure you pre booked online before you go. It will guarantee that you get to enjoy the Eiffel Tower without being in a queue for hours and be there at the time you like. We went there at dusk before heading for dinner at Le Chateaubriand and it was simply perfect! I had an amazing time with my boyfriend in Paris this year celebrating my birthday...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FriscoTraveler_11
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed at the Champs-Elysees Marriott for a week in early August. We have stayed here previously, and the service was excellent; noticeably warmer than the last few times we have visited. Our room was good sized and quiet, bathoom was adequate sized and clean, although not as luxurious as some other Marriotts in which we've stayed. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and have absolutely no complaints about the hotel. It is located in a very central part of Paris, and therefore convenient (within walking distance) to nearly all of the tourist sights. We are a "foodie family", and if we could offer one piece of advice, it would be to book restaurants in advance (the hotel concierges were happy to help us with a list I sent them several weeks in advance of our arrival) and AWAY from the area of the hotel. We have learned the hard way that the area around the hotel lacks good (which means for us, authentic, reasonably priced, well staffed, and slightly family-friendly) restaurants, so we planned well in advance this year, and our preparation was well rewarded. Our thanks to the Marriott family for their excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “In general a good experience.”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here primarily for the location and because I'm a Marriott elite program member. The hotel in general was very good and one of the better Marriott's I have stayed at in Europe. Our room was very nice, large, quiet and had an over sized bathroom. The breakfast was great and free, but overpriced if you had to pay for it. The Internet- Wifi don't work anywhere in the hotel which was a problem for us because we couldn't use our laptop. The hotel said there was a problem and they were working on it. To help us out they allowed us to use the computers in the business center free of charge, which helped. In general a good experience and I will use this hotel again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “one of my favorite hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: alsheikh11
Reviews.Content: every thing is good in this hotel, but the worst thing was when i ask the doorman for taxi the run away from me and i was witting for them until some one from the hotel come to help me

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sean J
Reviews.Content: If you must stay in the Champ Elycee area, this is a fantastic hotel. Being a marriott platinum member, I also recieved free breakfast, and free internet. (there is not concierge lounge) My room was tiny with no view, and a bit noisy. You cannot beat the location; it's in heart of Paris. If you don't have to stay at the heart of Paris, you are probably better saving 300 euros per day by staying a hotel in a different location. The majority of the patrons of this hotel are Arabs, and all the signs and menus are written in French, English and Arabic. They event have an Arabic only menu for room service. I tried a couple of items on the Arabic menu, and they were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “A dependable Marriott and best location”
Reviews.Author: KatD59
Reviews.Content: A lovely Marriott right on the Champs-Elysees! Beautiful lobby, great rooms and beds. Location is superb and provides a great launching off point for walking around many great historic sites. Close to Lauderee's, Arc-de-Triomphe, shopping on Avenue Montaigne. Many sidewalk cafes nearby. Would go back to this Marriott in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but ... underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: RickyRage
Reviews.Content: Note upfront: I booked this hotel using Priceline's "Name Your Own Price" feature. This hotel is in a beautiful place, towards the end of the Champs Elysees. I had never been to Paris before, and was shocked at the crowds on the street! The hotel lobby itself is also quite beautiful, and the amenities seemed quite nice. The positives: the room was comfortable, had very thick curtains, was very quiet, and the concierge in the hotel was first class. He gave us several recommendations for restaurants nearby that were excellent. The "mediocres": There was nothing really negative about this hotel, but there were a few things that you should be aware of. First, the front desk folks were less than receptive to our requests. They weren't "rude" but they certainly weren't as welcoming as other hotel reception desks have been. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, and we waited in the lobby for about an hour even though we arrived in the mid-afternoon (well after check in time). Our room was clean, but there were stains on the sheets, and on the bathroom floor. For the entirety of our stay (3 nights) there were two mattresses sitting in the hall outside our room. Again, none of this seems like a huge problem, but they were all the type of experience you would hope to avoid with a hotel that is this expensive. The reception did offer to cover our drinks while we were waiting, good thing since the sodas we ordered in the lobby were 7 euros each!!! Overall, the hotel was very nice, but a poor value given the service we received. I would think there are better options for the price in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay on points!”
Reviews.Author: denicar
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, the usual Marriott high end expectations met. GREAT Location. Close walk to many attractions, easy to grab the metro to anywhere My teenage daughter and I went out late every evening, shopping and wandering. Staff friendly and helpful. Room was spacious. 2 rooms down the hall from eachother, not next door. One was much nicer layout than the other. Beds not particularly comfortable. Couldnt justify the price wtihout the points though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: gitika143
Reviews.Content: It indeed was a lovely experience staying at the hotel.The staff and especially the Concierge desk was a big help orienting us to best places.We don't speak french at all and they helped us a lot in getting all the arrangements done quickly. The rooms were spacious,well maintained with a warm atmosphere.We had three rooms and each had its own Parisian charm. What my youngest son enjoyed the most was that the exit brought us straight to the most beautiful street of Paris.I am supposed to go back in Decembre this year but for my Company this time.Look forward to visit this hotel again.Thanks MARRIOTT;

Reviews.Title: “Chunnel to Paris”
Reviews.Author: kr2travel
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to stay at this Marriott property and using my points for 2 nights, I finally got the chance. It was well worth the wait. As a Marriott Rewards gold member, I was treated to a wonderfully quiet high floor room with a view. They also included breakfast that was over the top with so many selections, I couldn't choose. The service was impeccable and the staff very friendly. If you just want to live it up on the Champs, consider this hotel as one of the best in that area. It's just steps away from the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to visit Paris again so that we can stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Naitingale
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Very knowledgeable and courteous concierge and front desk personnel. It is quite expensive and my husband and I only spent one night. It would have received five stars but our bathroom had some drainage issues. We called guest services and it was fixed right away. The breakfast was not very good and the scrambled eggs did not look or taste like eggs at all. However, the room and the bed were very nice, plush, and comfortable. We woke up the next morning wishing we could stay one more night! All in all, it is a good hotel for the amount that you pay to stay here. It is located in the best possible location -- right in the middle of the Champs Elysee (close to the Arc de Triomphe). There is a metro stop just about a block or two away from the hotel if you do not want to spend all your euros on taxi fare. If you happen to have enough Marriott points, don't spend them on some lower-level hotel, use them here!

Reviews.Title: “location location”
Reviews.Author: zeevik
Reviews.Content: good location, clean, service good prices high....

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Marriott's in Europe”
Reviews.Author: phillyphlyer40
Reviews.Content: I have stayed extensively throughout Europe in many Marriott properties, and this hotel is in the top 3! First off, it is a HUGE hotel, in a VERY busy street! If you are not into the hustle-bustle of this high energy street-stay elsewhere! Check-in was smooth and efficient. I had reserved two rooms, and pre-called the hotel to make sure they were connecting rooms. Upon arrival, our rooms were not ready. The hotel accomodated us in one of the rooms for a short time, while the other room was prepped. We ended up with a beautiful suite and standard room connected to each other, overlooking the back gardens. The staff said it is not as scenic as the rooms in the front, but definately much quieter. Sleep was easy. Quiet-full windows that opened for the cool breeze, and the usual nice Marriott beds. The common areas of the hotel are amazing. From the lobby and bar to the restaurant. As a Platinum member we were given free FULL-breakfast for each of us and our 2 kids in the restaurant each day. (This was work +$100/daily). The buffet as mentioned elsewhere was wonderful. Full of fresh fruit, pastries, and all of the typical US type breakfast foods. The best part of the fresh made eggs and the GREAT chef there. All of the staff seems to have a great personality, but this one individual made our time there special! The hotel is located in the typical expensive tourist area. If you are looking for cheap food-get on the metro/taxi. If you are looking for convenience, eat at one of the dozen or so places close by. We will definately return to THIS hotel when in Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Kelvin C
Reviews.Content: My family just finished a week long stay at the hotel and we couldn't have asked for better. The hotel sits right in the heart of Paris along the Champs-Elysees with easy access to everything. The staff was very pleasant and always accomodating. The rooms were what you'd expect from a Marriott, well appointed, modern, and clean. Despite the rumors I had heard about the size of Parisean hotel rooms, our room with 2 queen beds was very adequate to accommodate our family of 4. if shopping is your thing, there are shops all around, if dining is your thing, there's great places to dine all around, and if just plain old site seeing is your thing, there's plenty to see withing walking distance to the hotel. The closest metro train stop to the hotel is the Franklin D. Roosevelt station, which is about a block or so away. We had a great time there and would definately stay there again. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: patrishg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the "center" of the heart of Paris. Half a block from the Arc de Trioumph, close to the Eiffel Tower, Seine River and right by the Metro for easy travel. This hotel is a category 8 Marriott; excellent service to your room and the absolute best breakfasts I've ever had. Don't stay here w/o trying their buffet breakfast. Tables and tables of breads and butters and jams and a bounty of fresh fruits and such a variety of meats and cheeses. It was not to be excelled anywhere. Their version of French Toast is to die for, something like toasted French toast w/liquid creme brulee over it. The service of waiters/waitresses here it tops. Quite the experience to stay in this posh Marriott in the perfect centrally located spot. The buses and Metro are a great way to travel around. We took a night dinner cruise down the Seine River past the Eiffel Tower just as it lit up. Breathtaking experience.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible !”
Reviews.Author: marionvilaire
Reviews.Content: It was my first time here and it was amazing !! the location can not be better because you are in the middle on the champs elysees !! You ll find all the shops you need close to the hotel (luxurious like vuitton to cheap like H&M). Also a lot of cafe , fast food & bar all around ! The hotel is charming and lovely and the staff just perfect ! The concierge was always available to help us and give us some good adress to discover paris with a local eye ! The metro is really close otherwise you ll find a lot of cab everywhere ! Last advice : order a cocktail at the bar, they are AMAZING !!

Reviews.Title: “Location Locatio Location”
Reviews.Author: chervin18
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Champs-Elysees which is the busiest and popular street in Paris. My wife and I have stayed here several times and we've enjoyed both times. The hotel is very close to the Metro/subway (a few minutes walk). It is only less than 10-minute walk to the world famous Louis Vuitton flagship store. A huge Sephora store is right next to the hotel. As for restaurants, there are many along Champs-Elysees but be prepared to pay premium pricing. The concierge and staff are very friendly and always willing to help. Overall, this is a great hotel to stay because of location and good service. The only drawback is the price which is obviously subjective.

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: Zeevrubi1
Reviews.Content: Hotel ok, service far , location the best in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Queenqueen18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Champs ElysÃ©es for he first time in July, and I really would like to recommend this place (Lobby Bar / Restaurant and Reception staff) as a great experience I had. The location was superbe and we had the luck to see the famous arrival of the Tour de France. It was just fantastic !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gfgissel
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Champs-Elysees provides guests with excellent, friendly service and luxury accommodations. Although our room was not overly large, it was tastefully decorated and very comfortable. As Platinum members, we received complementary breakfast (normally 29 euros per person). The food and service were excellent. The French Toast was beyond fabulous. This propertyl is in one of the best locations in Paris with easy access to the Metro and many bus lines along with shopping and restaurants on the famous Champs-Elysees. It's within easy walking distance from the Arc de Triomphe and reasonable walking distance from the Eiffel Tower, Orsay Museum, Place de la Concorde and many other destinations. The Metro and RER provide inexpensive, convenient rail service to and from CDG airport and major Paris train stations. This is an expensive hotel, so it will not fit every budget (we used Marriott Points for our stay). That being said, if you have the money or the points to stay at the Marriott Champs-Elysees, by all means do so. You will be delighted.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: kor_ger
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting Paris for the first time, have money to spend (this hotel is expensive), are looking for a hotel close to everything, look no further. Yes, I'm sure you can find other hotels that are cheaper but it wouldn't be right ON the Champs Elysees, have the Marriott comforts such as spacious rooms (even in Europe), cleanliness, comfortable beds, and a brand you can trust. I had a suite overlooking the Champs Elysees and it was wonderful. You can still hear the city life with the window and curtains drawn but then again, you're in Paris! Who cares? I would recommend this hotel to my mother...and she's not easy to please when it comes to hotel standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great View”
Reviews.Author: Chiefen72
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights stay at this hotel. And asked for a larger family room with view of the Champs Elysee! And got it! The staff at the check in were very very friendly! The excellnt view of the street and all the ongoing shows entartained us allot but the noise could be a bit disturbing! The location of this hotel is excellent, basically for any activity. The breakfast is average, and restaurants are a bit expensive. The room service didnt work out very well. We ordered a hamburger and after 40 minutes got a call that they couldnt deliver it?!?! Overall, good location and strongly recommend a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: RnR609
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just 1 day during our trip (wish we had stayed longer!). It is a very nice hotel, spacious room and very comfy bed! We used our points (and my husband is platinum) so breakfast was included...it was amazing! You could eat this and be ok til dinner. One thing, the hotel staff was not as knowledgeable about what to do or how to get places and the concierge was always busy. But it might have been the time of day/year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: rlouisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Champs Elysees for a week and enjoyed our stay. The room was always clean, and the food at the morning breakfast was great also. The only issue we came across was with the wireless internet connection. It would continually drop, and became annoying. The beds were comfortable, the hotels attendants were very good helping if needed, but they didn't out of there way to do so. The best part of this place is the location, many good restaurants and shopping around, and close to public transit if wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the inconveniences!”
Reviews.Author: mcnmd
Reviews.Content: For a category 8 Marriott ( and I have stayed in many wonderful 7 and below ), this did not meet expectations. Many rooms without outside window egress/excessive noise after midnight in halls/not as convenient geographically as many places I have stayed in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Marriott”
Reviews.Author: gwera
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our France vacation in 2010. This hotel has a great location and we were able to secure a very low rate in advance. What we like about Marriott was the American feel of the hotel. Often in Europe you can pay a lot for an old historic hotel that feels too old. The Marriott feels fresh and new. We were in a small room but the bathroom facility was quite nice. The bed looked like a roll-away or fold out however. The location is excellent of course and the Metro is quite close. The hotel rooms are pretty quiet in spite of all the action on the main road below. The prices of everything from the room to extras are quite high but Paris seems to be the most expensive hotel city we know of. Try â€œPaulâ€� nearby for pastry and coffee if you need a snack. In general: predictable big American hotel feel in Paris. We liked it and would stay again if we got an attractive rate. Getting a taxi in or out especially with bags is tough.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Europe-07-09-11
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Centrally located, very nice amenities, and good service. Very expensive and in a very expensive neighborhood so food and beverages are beyond expensive. Would recommend if using points and are prepared for $10 to $15 waters, soft drinks, coffee etc. The room without points was around $900 a night. Huge value with points.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kozlik700
Reviews.Content: I am still smiling from my stay at this hotel! The staff were friendly, the Concierge was great (Leander), the breakfast a full Marriot one but with French cheeses and some other great touches. I love this place, worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: TheVanNordens
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The rooms area bit small but nice and very clean. It was within walking distance to many sites and right next to the subway system. The hotel restaurant wasn't great but who cares, you can walk blocks and find great cafes to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “Un visite trÃ©s horrible...”
Reviews.Author: foodbuff880
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this hotel? TripAdvisor lists it as a five star. It is not. This is three star tops, at an overwhelming price. When we arrived, the elevator was broken so we had to take the stairs. This is fine, but inexcusable for the price. When we got to the room, overlooking the lobby I might add, we had to ask for power converters three times before anyone actually showed up. Then, they did not work. At night, the door did not close all the way to lock, so we were forced to chain it and hope for the best. Awful. And the cramped hallways smell like smoke. Do not stay here....

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: pili11
Reviews.Content: we spent five days at the Paris Marriott Champ Elysees and it was wonderful. The staff went out of their way to make our stay nice. The breakfast buffet was delicious and all in all we had a very good experience. The location is superb. We were able to walk everywhere and if not, the metro is less than a block away. Another nice Marriott experience.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly placed jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: cutrock
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here, we decided to stay for 3 nights. It was wonderful! The rooms are large an comfortable. We had a king sized bed, and it was very comfortable. We arrived via the RER/Metro from CDG airport (more on that later). We exited the Metro at Roosevelt, and the hotel was just about a half block away. The entrance is SOOO small, that we walked right past it! We had to go back to look for #70. Nevertheless, as soon as we entered, we were professionally greeted and relieved of our bags. The interior reception area is very nice, and the staff is impeccable. We arrived around 1:30 pm, but unfortunately our room was not ready, even though we had requested early check-in prior to our arrival. So, we had to come back after 3pm. No worries, because we just went to grab some lunch on the Champs Elysees, then walk over a couple blocks to admire the Arc of Triumph. When we finally got to our room we were pleasantly surprised. It is indeed 4 stars. We knew to request a room at the back of the hotel overlooking the atrium area so that we would have more quiet. After a day of Paris action, the last thing you want to hear is traffic and street noises from the Champs Elysees. And let me tell you, it goes on WELL into the night. They gave us a room on the top floor (#7). All the amenities were provided including a bathrobe, which we loved. They have flat panel tv's with various world channels. Not much in the way of English language tv though. Just boring CNN international and BBC. I have an iPhone, and was impressed that they offer a remote speaker set for you to plug your device into to play your music. A very nice, modern touch. They also provided free internet service in the room. We had breakfast every morning at the restaurant, and it was very nicely apportioned. There's a chef there who will cook your eggs to order, and the variety of foods is just as good as a restaurant. Breakfast was included with our room reservation since we are gold members. They provide USA Today for those who need to keep up on events. The royal couple was getting married that weekend, and it was all over the news...snore... They have a nice little workout facility with a spa and sauna and showers. They even provide towels, fruit, and drinks for free. A nice touch. The elevators are small and surprisingly somewhat creaky, but hey, that's typical in Europe. You are centrally located very well from everything in Paris at this Marriott. We were able to walk a nice big circle around the city in one day that took us first to the Arc of Triumph, then down to the Eiffel Tower, over to the Rodin Museum, then to Luxembourg Gardens, then to the Latin Quarter for lunch. Then to Notre Dame, then to the Louvre, the Tuilleries Gardens, then back up the Champs to the hotel. Yes, it can ALL be done in one day walking...we did it. Don't bring kids on this walk though...it'll be more like the Bataan death march for them. We went back to the hotel and enjoyed a bottle of wine on our balcony and relaxed. It was heaven. Later that evening, we walked back down to the Eiffel Tower to see the light show they give there at the top of the hour. It was spectacular to see it in person, very romantic, and it only takes about 15 minutes to walk it. Previous people have posted here that there are a lot of Middle Easterners at this place. It is true, but when I was walking around down a block from the hotel and up a couple more blocks, I noticed that the Embassy for Kuwait is there...so maybe that's why. I didn't notice the staff giving them any preferential treatment, however. A bit off topic, but a comment about arriving from the CDG airport. It was easy to get to the hotel. So you can take that if you want to save a lot of Euros rather than taking the Bus (the 2nd least expensive option at around 50 euro) or the taxi (outrageously priced at 90-100+ euro). Buy a RER ticket at the station, they speak English if you don't speak French. It costs about 19 Euro total for two people. You Take the RER to Chalet Les Halles, then transfer to the Metro, direction La Defense and get off on Roosevelt. It's the best exit because it has an escalator if you've got luggage. HOWEVER, on the RER train ride in from CDG , you do go through some seedy areas of outer Paris where you'll see shanty towns. We encountered lots of "angry" African immigrants. There were tons of them, and they all swarmed the train and just packed it up like sardines so you could barely breathe, let alone move. The mob had no intentions of waiting for the next train. Some were particularly hostile because there were a number of passengers with luggage coming directly from the airport, and it took up precious room. Very, very rude encounter, so you've been fairly warned. You should try to get a seat in the cubicles and away from the doors, otherwise you could wind up in a booby trap. I learned this lesson, so I made sure to follow my own advice on the ride back to the airport. HOWEVER, a different encounter ensued on the way back. I placed my backpack over my head on the small luggage rank (which was too small to hold our actual luggage). And when we eventually went through the seedy part of the ride, a number of roving Arab youth got on the train looking to steal from unsuspecting passengers. This teenager apparently was casing us out, and sat right behind us. When the door opened at one of the seedy stops (there's about 3 of them in a row), he tried to grab my backpack and bolt! Luckily another French speaking couple had seen him and alerted me to the situation thereby preventing him from taking my bag. I had time to take charge of the situation, so he left empty handed. The bag was right above my head, too. But you can imagine how that would play out if he did get his hands on my backpack. You run off the train after the thief, the train leaves you behind, you run around a corner only to catch up to him and his gang of friends. Now you probably have to hand over any other valuables you've got and you're at their mercy in their territory. WATCH OUT. Keep your passport and money on your PERSON at all times! It's a shame that you have to constantly have your guard up. Be on alert for scammers, crooks and thieves, even in the City of Love.

Reviews.Title: “very nice love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: spyce
Reviews.Content: we just returned from an amizing trip. we loved the hotel. the location is excellent!!!! we didnÂ´t try the food so i can give an opinion. but we really love the room. it was big, the beds are wonderful!!the bathroom was very modern and big!!the satff is great and very helpfull... we will return.. and yes i really recomend this hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good for families -- solid B or even B+”
Reviews.Author: justinsdad
