Reviews.Content: Service at front desk is very good. Not just professional but courteous and kind. Rooms are the largest I've ever seen anywhere in the world - and I travel a lot. Our room was about 450 sq ft but felt even bigger. Bathroom shower is quite nice. Chic, marble, etc. The downsides are: towels are almost motel 8 (ragged, discolored, and smelly). Mattresses are not firm enough for those with bad backs. To the hotel's credit they changed the mattress once but it still was not firm enough. I'm guessing the towel smell comes from the soap they use to clean it since almost 95% of the towels smelled like vinegar. When it did not smell like vinegar, it smelled foul. Location is fine. 15 to 20 min walking to Tuileries Garden or Eiffel. There is a small park next to the hotel that has a carousel, movie theater, and Guignol shows for kids. My kids don't speak French but loved the Guignol shows (4 Euro each) that last 30 min. Special kudos to Customer Relations Manager Fabien and his colleague Maria Ferrari in room reservations. They have angelic patience and true kindness and care for the customer -- very much up to Bill Marriott's visions and standards. Those towels and mattresses don't do them justice!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: casa56
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, it was really stunning it was very clean and well-kept, its location was the best part. It was located right on the Champs-Elysees about four blocks from the Arc de Trioumph and about two blocks from this great restaurant on the sidewalk on the Champs-Elysees...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Griffith85
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at this hotel using Marriott points. The room (622) was spacious, esp the bathroom and very quiet. We would recommend not accepting a room facing the Champs Elysees as the street is very noisy all the time even late and even though it was off season. Unlike other high category Marriott hotels, this one had few amenities...it is all about the location. The concerige service was inconsistently accurate about arrangements made. So do check back on anything you arrange with them. The breakfast buffet was pricey (29E) but very large, varied and complete. Usually in the am, we went 2 doors up from the hotel to Boulangerie Paul and chose fantastic pastries and beverage reasonably priced. Also there is a Monoprix (Super Target) a half block away in the other direction. George V Metro station very close and cab station right across the street. Walking distance to Arc and Tuilleries. If we had not used points, would have chosen another hotel due to the very high room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Marriot is always good :)”
Reviews.Author: PatricSA
Reviews.Content: We have generally found Marriott hotels to be very good but this is the best one we have stayed at. Staff were highly professional throughout. Food was excellent and the location perfect. It was, of course, not cheap but we thought good value for the money. We loved Paris and will go back again and we will certainly stay at the Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Use of Points, but glad I wasn't paying with $”
Reviews.Author: suzu1209
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 ended a 10 night trip of Noramandy with 5 nights in Paris. I am a Marriott Gold member and had enough points for 5 nights at the Marriott Hotel on the Champs-Elysees. The location is wonderful for a family with a tourist agenda --close to both metro and RER lines, multiple open top tour stops within steps of the hotel, 2 blocks to the Arche de Triomphe and many restaurant choices at varying price points closeby. The rooms were just like what you would expect at a JW Marriott in the US: 2 queen beds, separate bath and shower with marble finishes and Hans Grohe fixtures. The in-room internet was down most of our trip; however, had it been operational there would have been a 30 Euro charge for each 24 hour period. The standard charge for the room of 800 Euro was way out of my budget; however, I felt that it was a great use of my hard earned Marriott points. I "paid" 160,000 points for a 5 night stay for 1 room which accomodated 4 people (me, husband and 11 and 15 year old children) plus an 80 euro a night surcharge. The staff was polite and responded promptly to my nightly requests for ice and towels; however, neither the desk clerk or the concierge acknowledged my 260 nights spent in Marriott hotels over the last few years to earn my gold status and each seemed biased that I was not a "paying" customer.

Reviews.Title: “noisy location”
Reviews.Author: JoeD-stonybrook
Reviews.Content: This was a very expensive hotel, not owrth the money. We stayed on the street side and paid extra for the crowd noise and sirens. The room was beautiful; the linens were perfect. The bed was lumpy and needed a new matrass badly. The breakfast was a very pricey; go to the starbucks down the street. Would not recommend this Marriott, even if it has a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bonbon1399
Reviews.Content: Centrally located on Champs-Elysees, entrance was small with a closed gate, i think it is necessary to have gate closed on a busy road for security reason. Rooms are large and clean. I've got a duplex room that seperate bathroom and bedroom. It was very nice overlooking a side street. The first night i was that (friday night) was a little noisy, as people on the street was having fun till very late at night. The rest of nights was very quite. Service was excellent throughout the whole stay. Breakfast was delicious. Rooms a little expensive but it is all about location I think.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a surprisingly good location for a large meeting.”
Reviews.Author: fracmeister
Reviews.Content: I normally prefer the Hilton Arc de triomphe because i have stayed there so many times. However, the meetings were being held here and I was very pleased. First it is astonishing how large the hotel is given its narrow facade. The health club is not large but well appointed and has free energy drinks and the like. No executive lounge ;-{ but they did have free breakfast for me. the room service was excellent and the food good enough to eat there. near my favorite seafood place in the area (La Bouef sur la Toit) and easy walking to many of the fun things. I had impeccable service and was treated very well.

Reviews.Title: “THE location is worth every Euro”
Reviews.Author: SeabournFan
Reviews.Content: The Arc to your right, Louis Vuittton across the street, the Metro to your left, and the Champs-Elysees at your doorstep... this is THE location any Paris vacation needs to make it a perfect trip. HUGE rooms by Paris standards, polished staff, beautiful lobby any bistro, and true European doormen with 5 star class and value added tips. Spend the extra Euro's, you wont be dissapointed. 3rd stay & THE only hotel on the Champs & the only place i'd stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an Amazing location if you dont mind the masses of tourists”
Reviews.Author: carol_l_kelley
Reviews.Content: Hotel and staff are of the utmost quality. Onsite restaurant and room service are both outstanding. However, I hated walking out the front door and being trampled by the mass of tourists trying to get into the shop next door. Huge bathrooms by European standards.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaTraveler0
Reviews.Content: This may be the best Marriott I have stayed in. The service was friendly and outstanding. The hotel was well kept, clean, and efficient. Below are my observations: Stay We checked in on Sunday, 26 December 2010 and checked out on Saturday, 1 January 2011. We arrived at the hotel at about 12:30 PM after very long international flight. Arrival/Check-In The entrance to the hotel is somewhat small and is between the Cafe Montecristo and the Sephora cosmetics store. I never had to open the door of the hotel one time during my stay, as there is a bellman at the door at all hours. From the entrance you go up an escalator and check in is to the right. There should be no confusion between which desk is check in, since a big sign on the counter says "Reception". Check in time is 3 PM, but when we arrived the front desk already had a key ready for our room. The front desk staff was very efficient and spoke perfect English. We were staying on Marriott Rewards Points, and the check in staff was still very attentive and helpful. For our Marriott Rewards check in gift we chose a platter of fruit and two drinks. We asked that the gift be delivered to our room at 7 PM so that we would have time for a nap. Later, just like clockwork, the gift was delivered to our room at 7 PM. Room We were assigned to Room 422. As those who are familiar with European buildings know, the lobby is Floor 0, so in the US this would be the fifth floor. It appears that there are a small number of rooms that overlook Avenue Champs Elysee and that a large number of rooms overlook the lobby atrium. Our room had an exterior window that opened (yes the window could be opened) onto an open air courtyard. Thus the room was exceptionally quiet. The room itself was about the size you would expect in a standard Marriott in the United States. Immediately upon entering there was closet to the right that had shelves for luggage and adequate room to hang clothes. The closet also had an iron, ironing board, safe, two bath robes, and two pairs of slippers. Upon entering the room to the left there was a large bathroom. It had a large glassed in shower with both a wall mounted shower head and a hand shower. The bathroom also had a large soaking tub with hand shower. The bathroom was stocked with high end shampoos, body washes, soap, and other necessities. It had a hair dryer, a large vanity, and plenty of shelves for storing your bath supplies. Most surprising the bathroom had a 115V outlet. Though the outlet would only accept non-polarized plugs, I was able to use it charge my Ipod and mobile phone. Unfortunately it was not powerful enough to power a curling iron. The room had a king sized bed, a desk with a chair, an arm chair with an ottoman, a dresser/tv stand, and a large flat screen television. The bed was very comfortable and had plenty of pillows. As I recall the TV had about 10 French , 10 Arabic, 1 Italian (RAI), 2 German, 1 Spanish, and about 10 English language stations. As I recall the English stations included CNBC Europe, BBC One Scotland, BBC World News, Sky News, and France24 English. The room also had an automatic minibar (don't remove items or you will be automatically charged for the item). Location/Transportation We traveled from the airport to the hotel, and around Paris, on the metro or RER. If you arrive at CDG Airport, simply go to the ticket office at the CDG Train Station to buy a ticket upon arrival. The station staff we dealt with spoke English. We traveled with the Passe Navigo Decouverte, which is a smart card that does not require the hassle of paper metro tickets (Google this for more information). From the Airport, you simply take the RER Train to the Chatelet-Les Halles Station, and then transfer to the Metro Line 1, going towards La Defense. Get off Line 1 at the Franklin D. Roosevelt Station. While the hotel is between the George V and Franklin D. Roosevelt Stations, it is nearer Roosevelt. In addition, there is an exit from the Roosevelt Station that has an escalator, which is very helpful if you have any bags. The Franklin D. Roosevelt Station exit is at about 40 Avenue Champs Elysee, so you have to walk about two blocks to the hotel entrance. This hotel is located near a number of mega stores (Disney, Virgin) and is an area that sees a lot of tourist traffic- so be ready for a large amount of people on the street. Because of this the area is very busy and there are many stores nearby that could be of benefit to you. Less than a block from the hotel is a Monoprix, with a full grocery. Monoprix has snacks, fruit, and prepared foods (sandwiches, salads, etc.) for a quick, healthy, and cheap meal. A number of quick service restaurants such as Quick (my favorite), Paul, Brioche Doree, Pomme de Pain, and McDonald's are all nearby for quick meals as well. The hotel is only two metro stops from the Arc de Triomphe, so this would be an ideal start to your visit. Because the Franklin D. Roosevelt stations is served by two metro lines (1 and 9), you can get to most places faster by transit than you could by taxi. The ticket windows seem to always be busy at this station. Services The hotel offers any service that you would expect from a full service hotel. The concierge will make reservations for you at restaurants and will even mail postcards for you. There is a fitness room in the basement of the hotel that has free weights and exercise machines. We were walking a lot and did not use the fitness room, but did notice that the fitness room had free bottled water and showers for those using the area. The hotel had a business center with computers but we did not use it. There was wifi for 20 Euro a day, but we did not use it. The hotel also offers a laundry service. We found a self service laundry (laverie) at 48 Rue Berri, that was a 5 minute walk from the hotel. This laundry came in handy and meant we did not have to pack as many clothes. Food/Dining We only ate at the hotel for breakfast. As Marriott Rewards Platinum we received a full breakfast buffet each day (even on the weekend) for no additional charge. The breakfast had eggs, hot and cold meats, cereals, breads, fruit, juice, and a whole bunch more. If you are paying for the breakfast buffet it would be 29 Euro, so you may want to go next door to Quick if you want to save some money. Breakfast was served from 6:30 AM to 11:30 AM during the week and until Noon on weekends. The restaurant menu had everything from hamburgers to fish and steaks. The prices did not seem unreasonable, but we opted for more budget items nearby. From what we saw the food did look tasty. There is 24 hour room service. Safety As noted above there is a doorman that controls the entrance to the hotel, and security staff is visible in the lobby. You need a key card to use the elevator to get to guest rooms. This hotel was a quiet refuge from the hustle of Avenue Champs Elysee. I saw very few beggars in the area and felt very safe in the subway and going to and from the hotel. Overall We really can't think of any complaints about this hotel. The service was great and was of the highest quality. The room rate is not cheap, but I think it would be a good value given the location and what you get for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a quick Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: JaeTraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a stay at the Marriott Champs-Elysees using points, and like many other reviewers, I was happy to reap the rewards of having Marriott status. The hotel is in a prime location for a tourist in Paris - right on the Champs-Elysees close to the FDR Metro stop. It truly helped make touring the city a breeze. Our room was in the back facing the courtyard, so while it was quiet, it didn't offer the stellar views of the city lights (which would have been lovely, I imagine, since the Champs-Elysees was lit for the holidays while we were there). It was a nice room, with a comfortable bed. The only thing slightly odd was the placement of the showerhead, along the side of the tub rather than at the end of it. Otherwise, no complaints. The service was great, as would be expected from a Marriott. A continental breakfast buffet was included in our stay (otherwise around 30euro). The variety and quality of the spread was fantastic - we often ate enough for breakfast to hold us over for a good portion of the day. Truly the greatest benefit of the hotel is the location. The convenience of being able to easily navigate the city just steps from the doorway was invaluabe. It truly is a lovely hotel that is lavishly decorated and very well kept, and I'm happy that being a loyal Marriott customer has paid off.

Reviews.Title: “Inexcusable disregard for guest safety - Food Poisoning”
Reviews.Author: SaltyDog79
Reviews.Content: I have been a Marriott Gold member for ages as I travel frequently for business and have stayed at Marriotts all over the world. This past weekend my significant other and I decided to go to Paris for the weekend for a "just us" weekend before Christmas. I had stayed at this hotel before and found the location to be excellent and thought it a great way to use some of my Marriott points. A few things to note really: The location is excellent. The heating/air con is from 1970 and without a thermostat. It's a strange dial and button combo that's a bit of a guessing game. We never could get our room cool enough to sleep. I cannot speak to all other rooms but the wifi signal in 121 was so low it was unusable. A few other guests mentioned the same issue so it's worth your while to check the signal in the room before unpacking if you need internet access. The Concierge is awful. As noted on here by other reviewers the concierge service was unreliable. For a 5 star hotel this is simply unacceptable. Upon arriving on Friday night we requested the concierge book us a restaurant for Saturday night. He listed a few options from which we chose Le Duc a seafood restaurant and a time of 8:30pm. We also asked that he book us a taxi for 8pm to get to the restaurant. He told us he would call us to confirm the reservation and the taxi was no problem. By Saturday midday we still hadn't heard from him but were not concerned as we figured if he couldn't get us into Le Duc then surely wherever he did book would be just fine. Upon returning to the hotel we discovered that we had no reservation for dinner nor did we have a taxi booked. Shenanigans ensued and we did eventually get in but this was not the relaxing romantic experience we hoped for. Nor once did he apologize. If you go book your own tables and transport or risk it. By Sunday night it was clear that most of Europe was having travel delays so before we departed we checked with the concierge on the status of the Eurostar trains. True to form he gave us erroneous info and told us all trains were running on time. Now if the internet had worked in the room we would have known this was not at all true and plastered all over every travel site known to man. So after one very unnecessary trip to the train station we came back to the hotel and checked in for another night. There are worse things than being stuck in Paris or so we thought. That night we chose to eat in the hotel restaurant. One very big mistake. It certainly wasn't cheap being a 200 pound meal. The things we ate in common were the beef carpaccio and the escargot. We had different mains. By 4am were almost simultaneously and violently ill. It became fairly clear that we had food poisoning of some sort. Now these things do happen in the nicest of places. It only takes one food handling mistake for someone to become ill and to be honest at that point I was pretty willing to consider it bad luck but did feel the need to tell the general manager so they could at least examine any remaining beef carpaccio and escargot and one would imagine not serve it to other guests. I called in the morning and asked to speak to the general manager and was told he would call back. More than 4 hours later and still no one had returned my call. I called again expressing just how ill we had become and that I felt this was a safety issue for other guests that should at least be known about. 2 hours later I got a call a man who was the head of guest relations, not the general manager. His name was Fabian or Fabio. When I told him how ill we had become he told me that there was no way the food we ate could have caused it because they buy there food from quality vendors and the kitchen has been inspected. So clearly Fabian has not the most basic knowledge about food safety or food poisoning or he would know all it takes is someone using an unclean spoon to cause it. But really it was his next statement that outraged me. I was most likely ill he said because I am an American and I'm not used to fine French cuisine. Nothing like adding insult to injury. And this American happens to live in Europe and my significant other spent his entire childhood in France but thanks for the theory! He also told me he had had excellent reviews of the beef carpaccio. So nothing was done. For all I know the chef was never even told. We were too ill to even stand up long enough to take a shower so we were stuck at the hotel for another night. The pain and stomach cramps were getting to a point where we really did consider going to the hospital as it was clear we were going to need medication of some kind. In the meantime we ordered a bottle of water from room service and the room service waitress upon seeing our condition was appalled and asked if we would like for doctor to be called to the hotel. Bless this woman. It would have been fantastic if say Fabien had mentioned this option! 250 pounds later we had a doctor who confirmed yes this was food poisoning and a round of antibiotics among other things. In grand total our delay due to illness cost us nearly 1000 pounds for the extra night plus the doctor plus medication etc. The hotel never once called to check on us never once offered so much as a bottle of water. In fact when we asked for clean robes they were never brought up. The food poisoning has been so severe that now two days before Christmas we are still eating no more than crackers and water. Our relaxing weekend before Christmas is now threatening to ruin not only the weekend before but Christmas itself. The customer service was the worst I have ever experienced. I have never given a 1 star review but blatant disregard for safety is inexcusable. Thankfully we are not old nor traveling with small children or this could have had a very different outcome. I'm sure in truth one big hotel chain to the next doesn't vary greatly but I have always been loyal to Marriott feeling it was a sure bet when away from home. Not any more. Buyer Beware! There are many wonderful hotel choices in Paris and right on the CE. There is no reason to give this one your patronage.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: stephenanstiss
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location at the center of the Champs Elysees, all sites are easilly accesable. Most of the hotels entrance is taken up by a large 'not so' discount perfume shop, but once beyond the entrance doors the hotel is quite inpressive with a large atria and attentive staff rather over zelousley reviewing incoming people as to their suitability to enter the hotel. Once passed these and with a reason to be there the front office staff are very friendly and attentive, the room i had was large, though interconecting and of high modern standards with ipod dock,in a funky travel case styled mini bar, and flat screen tv's whose sound also plays in the bathroom. Room service food was expensive but of good quality and 1 meal is enough for 2 to share anyway. Was staying for my birthday and had let the hotel know, they placed a bottle of champagne in the room and some cake.

Reviews.Title: “On the whole - pretty good”
Reviews.Author: EssexBarnes
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this particular Marriott and it was chosen this time purely for its brilliant location. I "normally" feel that the quality of the check - in experience sets the tone for your stay and our check-in was excellent. We were allowed to check in prior to the regulation time and all my requests (a pre ordered taxi for the evening and an extended check -out time) were granted ..........or so i thought - but more later! We had a two - storey room, which we simply loved. Bathroom as you walked in and the bedroom downstairs and as usual in Marriott fashion, the bed and the room were exceptionally comfortable. Late in the afternoon after some shopping we stopped in the lounge for a glass of something. Having waited 10 minutes for a member of staff to approach us i started to walk over to the bar whereupon i managed to attract a stewards attention and with a keen smile took our order for two glasses of champagne.................. 20 minutes later we were still waiting - i had to once again walk to the bar where another waiter took our order, with the drinks arriving in 3 miinutes and an apology that the previous steward had forgotten! Then our problems started....the taxi i had pre ordered hadnt been pre -ordered and i had to take pot luck outside in a "grid-locked" Champs Elysee, to get to a surprise birthday party before the birthday boy - Not surprisingly, this didnt happen! And by the way, the extended check out that i had been given wasnt booked either, as i received a call in my room at 12.15 telling me (very politely) that check out time was midday. Our room was at the back of the hotel and was very noisy, but obviously cant blame the hotel for that. Some excellent positives next. Tea and coffee ordered in our room early evening and it arrived quickly, plentiful and with the surprise of some rolls & Jam (what a lovely touch). Also a light room service breakfast - bang on time and delicious. At the time, the negatives stressed me out - but as i say in the title - on the whole it was pretty good and i will definitely stay here whenever i am in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location”
Reviews.Author: lovelabslots
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night at this hotel in Paris, but it was a great stay. The room itself was large for European standards. The room also had great amenities, including a nice bathroom and speakers in the bathroom from the TV which was unexpected. The location is very good and right in the middle of tons of shopping and easy cab ride to Eiffel tower and other sites. Service was also strong, we requested early check in and our room was ready on arrival at 11am. I would not suggest booking the romance package. We did, and it wasn't all it was cracked up to be. We received champagne and strawberries, but no flowers and the strawberries weren't exactly what I was expecting for a snack platter. We did get a late check out with the package so that was nice. Overall, very nice hotel and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location for More Popular Parisien Sights”
Reviews.Author: ShannyStL
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice, four-night stay at the Paris Marriott (3rd floor). We were able to check-in mid-afternoon. According to some of the reviews, we were a bit worried about noise but we only heard street noise or late night partying a couple of times (briefly) during our stay and easily returned to sleep. Aside from the escalator being closed for repairs for approx 1/2 the trip, there were no major issues at all with either the cleanliness or overall comfort. Service was slow in the lobby for a late night cocktail, but, overall, we had a very nice stay and would recommend the hotel to friends. Bell staff and Concierge (Hans) were all very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loyalty Has Its Priveleges!”
Reviews.Author: SKG109
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on points. They gave us a fantastically large room with a balcony overlooking the C-de-E, and a view of the Eiffel Tower!!! We had to peel ourselves back into the room at night! The complimetary breakfast was great, with the Egyptian chef, making custom omlettes! The staff was always smiling and helpful. Great location! We walked to the Louvre, the Notre Dame, the multiple museums, the Eiffel Tower. We only used the trains for the Versailles and the Sacre Coeur. Thank you staff for helping make this a great anniversary celebration! PS: the charges for the internet were, regretfully stupid, in the business center!

Reviews.Title: “nothing to complain about here”
Reviews.Author: sko11546
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff was helpful and friendly. It was close to the Metro and plenty of shopping if you want to spend the money. We used points so I cannot comment of the value, but we were more than satisfied. We had some problems with connectivity to my Ipad but they contacted the company and it was resolved. there was a 30 euro charge on our bill for the call but it was taken off once we cleared it up. Breakfast was excellant. Omlettes and everything else you could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Marriott i've ever been to”
Reviews.Author: Jamietraveller
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for one night for my girlfriends birthday. The recent renovation has stripped what character it used to have out of the place, and the staff do not know what good service or running a 4-5* hotel means. From the constant interruptions by housekeeping (3 times in the morning), the stone cold late breakfast with the most disgusting scrambled eggs i have eaten, to the non-functioning lift/door pass cards which were reset every time we needed to operate a lift or door and still never worked - we had to be escorted by a member of staff everywhere we went to make sure we could getmaround- this hotel was a co pelt disappointment. None of the above compared to the worst aspect of the trip though. When you pay 700 euros for a room in a 5 star hotel, you expect the hotel to go out of their way to make you comfortable. My girlfriend and i were stuck down in rue de rivoli some 1 to 2 miles away at 2.30 am and needed a taxi back so called the hotel. You might have thought that in the capital of France a five star hotel reception could get a chauffeur or taxi whatever time of night but not this one. We were given 2 hours wait time and ended up walking back. My girlfriend was bear foot most of the way due to high heals, twisted her ankle and ended up in tears. Whe. We got back the receptinists, far from being busy looking up taxi firms and a making calls were laughing in a staff room at something. After being escorted to our room because the keycards wouldn't work, we fell asleep. In the morning i complained to Fabian the head of customer services. As a regular Marriott user i started off by saying that i wanted to be constructive. Fabian had little sympathy for any of my remarks, saying things like the responsibility of the hotel to help you ends when you walk out the door I.e. I shouldn't have been asking them to book me a taxi from elsewhere in Paris. He clearly had no comprehension of the end to end service a hotel like that should offer. The one time you needed them, they weren't there for you. For a hotel that's lowest price rom is 700 euro, this is the worse Marriott i have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “best part of paris”
Reviews.Author: CindyH54
Reviews.Content: location, location, location! Best place to stay. Not only a beautiful hotel but located in the heart of all that is Paris. Shopping from Louis Vuitton, Sephora, Monoprix and Quick! Metro access to the Louvre, Eifel Tower, all touristy things. And after all the walking and exploring, its a pleasure to come home to the comfort that is this hotel. Even after almost getting mugged in Paris, I wouldnt say I enjoyed Paris if I had stayed anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: paulakaLondon
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. Dirty, unorganised and the rudest staff (even by Paris standards) I have ever encountered. We arrived to check in and were told we had to wait an hour. The food was absolutely horrid and the bathroom and room was dirty and run down. For the price we payed, one night was Â£600 for a standard room, it was shocking. Impersonal and bland. I will never be staying in a Marriot again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, iffy service”
Reviews.Author: J&H74
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived on September 10th for one night. We arrived to check in at about 3:30pm and were told despite our confirmed reservation for one bed, that they only had one room remaining and it was 2 double beds. Despite our reservation being booked by the travel agent, weeks in advance. We have stayed at this hotel many times and have enjoyed it immensely in the past. It could not be better positioned for access to many of the restaurants we like. The desk clerk informed us that this was the last room in the hotel and if we were unsatisfied with two beds then we were free to go to another hotel. Our travel agent contacted the manager on our behalf and was met with the same hostility. The implication was that the travel agent was American (which she is not) so she would not know what type of beds are available in European hotels. After about an hour and our having unpacked, a desk clerk called our room to say that they had a tiny room with one bed. We declined as we were there for one night. Our travel agent suggested to the manager that their mistake should result in some token adjustment for us for our inconvenience, he adamantly disagreed. At a rate exceeding $700 per night, we felt that the inconvenience that they created for us justified some accommodation. Both my wife and I had business meetings later in the afternoon and due to heavy traffic in Paris that day because of the strike that had just occurred protesting raising the retirement age in France, we had arranged our meetings in the public spaces of the hotel. It was a beautiful late autumn day and my wife and her attorney requested coffee in the hotel's lovely terrace garden. My wife's French attorney commented that the rudeness of the staff, acting as though they were supremely inconvenienced to be requested to have terrace service in the afternoon, was surprising as she is French. Public spaces are nice and there is a small, but adequate gym. Extremely rude front desk. As frequent travelers, this was most unacceptable behavior by the management.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for one of the best locations in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: dssrriri
Reviews.Content: Our experience here was awesome. I used reward points and was happy with the room - oversized. We did not get a room overlooking Champs Elysees, and was interior with an overlook of the lobby. The lobby was 'happening' with a bar and people seemed to hang out until 2 - 3 am everyday. There was a pianist every night until 10 pm or so. This is probably one of the best touristic locations to stay in Paris....the front door opens to Champs Elysees Rd, and is filled with cafes, street performers and simply a 'hang out happening' area with food and drinks abundantly available well into the dawn. The pizza at the restaurant opposite the hotel was simply outstanding. Room service at the Marriott, and the knowlegable concierge was awesome. Breakfast was average, and simply wasn't large enough to warrant a hotel of six star rating like this one. Clean rooms, with friendly staff and amazing location makes this a place where I will stay again! Note - if paying, the rooms seemed very expensive. The Marriott is also very cosmopolitan and seemed to be a favorite for Arabs from various countries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: msw20008
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for a total of 7 nights using Marriott reward points. Would gladly recommend this hotel. Clean rooms, comfortable beds, a nice breakfast, helpful staff and a really great location just steps from the Metro and the Arc de Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: masonhome
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights while in Paris this August. The lobby was nicely decorated with an understated entrance opening into a more luxurious lobby above. Our room was not ready when we arrived at 2:15, but we waited only 15 minutes until it became available. The room was large by Paris standards and decorated nicely, but certainly not outstanding in anyway. The granite bath was recently remodeled and large. We had a very quiet stay on the executive level overlooking a courtyard. I appreciated the quietness since outside on the Champs Elysees it was mobbed during our entire stay. Many posters have mention middle eastern guests at this hotel. We were here from Aug. 12-14 and did not encounter any. I mention this because some posters felt ignored and in the shadow of the other guests. We were very pleased with the service. I would recommend this hotel. While it was not outstanding, Paris is extremely expensive and I think we would have paid more to get something more. That being said, we didn't pay for our stay. We used Marriott points.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: lalalatracy
Reviews.Content: Rude reception staff, even worst at the Marriot Square cafe, It took 3 complaints & 50 minutes for 3 dishes to arrive, it then took a further complaint to the Assistant Manager to get the 4th dish out, of which the dish was no longer in an edible state, it was beyond our belief that a professional kitchen would allow a dish as such (burnt, dried & re-heated) out to customers, McDonalds would have served better. Worst Marriot ever!

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: Imajerzeygirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Tuesday at the Paris Marriott Hotel Champs-Elysees having taking the Eurostar over from London. It is in the old Louis Vuitton factory. Upon arrival the lobby seating area was filled with Saudis and Gulf guests. At first I thought there was a convention as we were the only ones not dressed in the Middle East garb. We had reserved a suite. As a Marriott shareholder and rewards member I inquired about upgrades, was told no. The suite was fine, located on the top floor, but nothing to write home about. Housekeeping never came before 4:30 the entire time and it was annoying to return to the room after touring to find the place not made up. The first night there, we received a call from our credit card company fraud dept. They said a $5900 charge had been put on the card. It turns out the Marriott Champs Elysees decided that instead of putting the 1st nights room on my card, they took it upon themselves to bills us--on the very first night--for the 4 nights we were staying. This is actually illegal. I called the front desk and was transferred to someone who said it was a 'hold'. No it was a lie. The bill was put through. I am a large Marriott stockholder and will pursue this, as it was insulting. The biggest problem with this hotel is they totally ignored westerners and fell all over the people from the Middle East. It became laughable as the concierge would look over the heads of westerners in line to deal with the sheiks, etc. Internet was $20 euros per day. Actually, I had planned to take photos of the suite to share with Tripadvisor, but decided no point. I would never recommend this hotel. Totally blah.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever, noisy all night”
Reviews.Author: GOarmywife
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great for sightseeing on foot. The hotel is clean...I am out of nice things to say. Our executive level room flooded from above, an a/c problem. The only room we could move to was one of the ones you step down into. The noise level form the street below between midnight and six in the morning was astounding. The food and beverage prices were astronomical. We asked for ice, after two calls and four hours, I went down and carried it up myself. We asked for an ironing board that was not broken, it took three calls and over thirty hours. We asked for two glasses, they never came. Yes, the lobby was filled with guests from Saudi. I wondered if perhaps guests like us were being ignored as the staff was overwhelmed keeping up with the big spender's demands.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Careful of Room Location”
Reviews.Author: kandd1963
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times and depending on the room so goes our stay. If you get there and recieve one of the rooms with a small foyer and a step down into the bedroom with a large window that looks out to the street do not be charmed. You will think "how wonderful" until night time. It will get so loud. Ask for a new room right away. As others have mentioned, every time I have stayed here the lobby is taken over by muslim guest. The large lobby seems to be used as an extention of the guests' rooms. If you are not part of the group you feel somewhat unwelcomed. The doorman seems to know who is coming and going. It makes you feel safe. The location is awesome. In the summer it stays light until 10:00. My husband gets tired and I hit the Champs to shop and sightsee. Paris is beautiful at Christmas time! or anytime really.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected - but loud blaring music ruined it”
Reviews.Author: gild1323
Reviews.Content: Having been to Paris 10 years ago, we came back for a one-night stay during our trip to London. We used my husband's Marriott points - and were expecting a small room since we weren't paying for it. (I don't even know how much the room would have been had we not used the points.) To our surprise, we were put in a spacious room on the first floor, with windows that opened up onto the Champs Elysees. There was a small foyer, with steps that led down to the "sunken" bedroom, which was spacious. King bed, twin nightstands, desk, dresser, chair and ottoman. The bathroom was huge, with a separate tub from the shower. Shower was nice but there was a huge step down into the bath area - make sure to be wide awake or it's a recipe for a nasty fall. When we arrived, it was too early to check in. The woman who checked us in, when hearing that we wanted to freshen up, gave us keys to access the gym which had showers and a dressing area. However, we couldn't find it based on the directions she gave us. (I did find it later, and it was tricky to get to.) Had the concierge hang onto our luggage while we went to the Tour d'Eiffell for lunch - it did seem like the concierge was inundated with people and we had to wait some time before being helped, without so much as a "be right with you." Fortunately, all of the staff spoke English, but I tried to at least start any conversation with "Bonjour!" and I think they were appreciative of that. I agree with one of the other reviewers - there were lots of Arab men in the lobby lounge that seemed to be there day and night. One was perhaps a sheik or some other dignitary wearing a huge turban; in the morning we went down for breakfast, and they had set up the area for them with all sorts of pastries, with napkins covering it until they arrived. Hours later when we checked out, the set up was still there - it was like they were instructed to make sure the area was ready for whatever second these people were arriving. Breakfast was included with our stay - it was fantastic - a nice buffet consisting of everything you could ever imagine, all good quality and fresh. From what I hear from others, it would have been pricey had we have paid for it on our own. Since this was right on the Champs Elysees, I expected it to be noisy. It wasn't - initially. It was situated next to the Sephora - and at times in the early evening they had loud music to try to lure people into the store. However, this couldn't be heard from inside the hotel unless we opened the windows. Later that night, there was a lot of activity from the world cup revelers- and it seemed like one big party outside. But again, we couldn't hear much from our room unless we opened the windows. However, at 7:30 AM, we were abruptly awaken by loud dance music that seemed to be coming from either the room next door or above us. When I say loud, I mean LOUD. We called the front desk to complain, and they said they would look into it. The music kept starting and stopping; just when we thought we would get back to sleep, on it came again. My husband went out to try to figure out where it was coming from and called the desk again. They said it was the Sephora next door, and there was nothing they could do about it. That was a bunch of BS - when I opened the window overlooking the Champs Elysses, it was quiet, with no noise anywhere. I also checked and the Sephora didn't even open until 10am. We think it may have bee the Arab sheik or whoever it was, and they figured they couldn't tell them to keep it down. So overall, nice place, nice location, but it was ruined by the loud music in the morning. I wish they would have been honest with us about its origin, rather than lie and blame Sephora. If I could be assured of a quiet room, I would consider staying there again. Glad it wasn't on our dime, or we would have asked for a refund. Yes, it was that loud.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet”
Reviews.Author: houstonmomofthree
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Paris and we picked a great hotel. Was hoping to check in at 10:30 AM when we arrived from the airport, but didn't happen. Checked our bags and walked to the subway- very close and convenient. Did some sightseeing, had lunch and returned to our hotel around 2:30- The room was ready, so off we went for a shower and nap. The room was very nice size with 2 queen beds and nice sized bathroom. This was perhaps the quietest hotel room I have ever stayed in. Never heard a noise from the hall or other rooms even though the hotel was full. The breakfast buffet was too expensive- but there were many coffee shops just steps from the door. Ate lunch at MichaelAngelos next door and it was delicious. The only negative that I can report is the number of Arab men who hung out in the lobby all day and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but The Room wasnt Ready at 3pm (Boo)”
Reviews.Author: TourGuideBarbie31
Reviews.Content: The location was awesome, rooms awesome, food great, bed comfy, most employees were nice. I'd stay again.....but wasn't happy with checking in at 10am and no room. They gave a late check out for the connecting rooms I booked. Um.... strange. Why would they grant that???? So they gave a 1pm check out when they knew the rooms was booked by me for the next 5 days. And I had told them when I would arrive. So my family and I went and ate lunch, came back and waited from Noon until 4pm for the room. Tired and jet lagged, in the atrium lobby...... other then that, the place was in a GREAT location. Wow to the location!!! Oh and I had to pay for WIFI. I got free WIFI at a hotel in India and Uganda, Africa, but Paris I have to pay. Come on Marriott! B+ overall

Reviews.Title: “An unbelievable experience!!”
Reviews.Author: alchemist8888
Reviews.Content: I've lagged at posting my glowing review. We were there Sept 2008. Because my husband has status at the Marriott, we were upgraded to the Presidential Suite. From the balcony we could see the Arc de Triomphe, Champs-Elysees street and the high-end shops. Paris was our first stop in France and the upgrade made this an amazing experience already. This trip was a special occasion for us. Thus, it was a pleasant surprise to come back to our room from a day of visiting museums to see 2 bottles of champagne and pistachio chocolate covered strawberries. The room had a sofa and was spacious by European standards. It's in a great location, close to the must-see spots and metro. We basically walked everywhere. The staff was very nice. Loved the room but we were shocked to find out that it cost $10,000/night with the exchange rate at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality, wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: Figaro522
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Marriott Champs Elysees for three nights in early June 2010. We loved the locationâ€”situated near plenty of shopping, we could walk to the Eiffel Tower relatively easily and were a couple of blocks away from the Arc du Triomphe. The Metro (Franklin D. Roosevelt) was literally a few steps away and we took it everywhere. The room itself was large, especially by European standards, and lived up to the 5-star quality. The employees at the reception area were very professional, friendly, and courteous. We ate breakfast one of the mornings at the hotel restaurant and had the buffet, which was very good. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in shopping district”
Reviews.Author: johnsmartin4050
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the Champs-Elysees shopping district and close to the Arc de Triomphe. Good hotel for Americans given that most of the staff spoke English and they had a very good buffet breakfast. The staff was very helpful. It is a bit far from some of the major attractions like the Eiffel Tower, but the route can be walked if you have a little time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FlyDC
Reviews.Content: Used Marriott points to stay at this hotel and it was worth every point ... We had reserved an executive room for points plus an $80 upgrade. We requested early check in but there were no executive rooms available for early check in. They gave us a regular room and didn't charge the $80/upgrade per night. This worked out great. We didn't spend alot of time in the room - so didn't really want the upgraded room anyway, but the regular room wasn't available via points on marriott.com. All in all a great deal. The 'regular' room was quite nice. Seems very newly renovated. Flat screen tv, ipod docking station radio, etc. Gym was small with 2 treadmills and only 1 eliptical - but never crowded, so I guess it works... Location is great - right in the middle of the CE. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant was awesome. (Free for Platinums.) Really good mushrooms.... and the croissants were great too! We ate at the Marriott Square sidewalk cafe our first night. It was good. Not great. But good. We ate lunch at the Montecristo next door. We would never go back! It was really, really bad. It seems like a night club that happens to serve food. Took forever to get our food and prices were ridiculous. Lots of complaining patrons but the staff didn't seem to care. We found (duh) that restaurants off the CE were cheaper and of much better quality.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ld2677
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the heart of Paris! You are only a couple of blocks away from the Arc, subway stops, great restaurants, and wonderful shops. The hotel staff was amazing!! My husband and I stayed there over thanksgiving weekend, and didnâ€™t know what to expect since this was our first time in Paris. To be honest we were expecting small rooms, snotty French attitudes, and for no one to speak Englishâ€¦.this all couldnâ€™t be further from the truth! The hotel is BEAUTIFUL! Clean, welcoming, and comfortable are the 3 descriptions I would. My husband and I got separate one morning, and he had our only overseas phone. I got back to the hotel and sheepishly spoke to the concierge and asked him where a public phone is so I can make a call on my credit card to so that I could find him. Within 2 seconds he called my husband, told me how to find him (aka drew me a map), and informed me where I could get some coffee on my way. He was heaven scent!!! This hotel is wonderful, and anyone who is going to Paris should at least go there for a drink in their lounge overlooking the Champs-Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: HeatherSanDiego
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a welcome surprise on the Champs-Elysees. The location is smack in the center, which can be extremely noisy. Our room was a delight! We stayed in two other hotels in Paris & in many ways liked this one the best. The room was large & comfortable. We had 2 queen beds & a window that did not open but overlooked the lobby. We liked the bathroom the best. It was quite luxurious, with a separate tub & shower & the largest vanity we had in Paris (out of 4 properties). It is right next door to Sephora - the flagship. Easy walking to many eateries. We did not eat at the hotel. The staff was extremely pleasant & gave us the best map of Paris, which I read returning to the USA that day.... I plan on returning to this property, which is walking distance to Arc de Triumph & the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “very quiet, comfortable, exclusive”
Reviews.Author: alaskanexile
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel on the Elyssee. Except for the doorman, you would not know it is there. Great location for a short stroll up to the Arc de Triomph, or down to the Louvre or Pont Neuf. Soundproof rooms- you literally couldn't hear anything outside of your room, great for sleep. Perfect bathrooms. For price,(700E/night) would think wireless should be included? Breakfast buffet extensive and good, although only one attendant for omelets- too long of a wait. Excellent coffee, though. Although we ate dinner elsewhere every night, the menu looked excellent, was tempted every time. If you want a perfect respite from the bustle of Paris- this hotel is for you; if you want Parisian character, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Outragiously Fine Service”
Reviews.Author: marjon422
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 star in the absolute best location. The staff have a keen eye for customer service and the General Manager,Johan Kamerbeek and his Customer Service Supervisor,Morigann Hervouet are to be commended for the job they are doing along with all the staff we came in contact with. Iris De Bruin,Reception Supervisor started the ball rolling on a First Class stay which was ending a 15 day Anniversary Trip.In addition to being very beatiful,she has a wonderful way of welcoming.What an asset! John Hannan Cary NC USA

Reviews.Title: “Not as 5 star as it seems”
Reviews.Author: babymoto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I redeemed Marriott points to take a dream vacation to Paris for a week. After a ton of research we decided that the Marriott on the Champs Elysee was the perfect location, and had everything we thought we needed. We were sadly disappointed. Yes, the location is great, but this is not truly a 5 star hotel. I've stayed in 3 star hotels that were better. The restaurant was ok - the service was good, but food so-so. The front desk was helpful, but the conceirge was lazy, extremely rude and unhelpful. When asked for tour recommendations - we choose to answer his personal cell phone instead and then proceeded to use Google to get the information - hello I just needed info on how to get to Versailles??? Had hoped for a concierge lounge - there isn't; or a patio or a veranda to enjoy the view - there isn't; and didn't like the endless party outside the door. Who would have thought that the Sephora next door would be a source of endless parties, pick-pockets, gypsies seeking money, kids hanging out, and all sorts of shady characters hanging out all night as soon as the sun went down. Will definitely not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: ikespop
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Champs-Elysee is fantastic! ALL of the staff is attuned to customer service. This was the vacation of a lifetime for us and this particular Marriott did not disappoint. The concierge(s) were absolutely fantastic. Can't find enough good words for these folks. Give them a look.

Reviews.Title: “As one would expect, a very nice hotel on the C-E”
Reviews.Author: Voyageur510
Reviews.Content: Alas, we only stayed at the hotel for one night (using points), but we were quite pleased with everything. Being right on the C-E, the hotel is in the middle of everything. The entrance is very unassuming, but there is a doorman. The lobby is very nice and all staff were polite (most appeared to have some working English, but we tried to converse in French for the most part). Our room faced the interior atrium of the hotel and it was nice. Everything was immaculate. Both the bathroom and the room were quite large and we had plenty of space to move around. We are already saving up points for our next visit to the hotel. Not much more to say--this is the only hotel on perhaps the most famous street in the world ,so expectations were high and it did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Blessed_Lady0519
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 24 March until 2 April. Our family of four (husband, 9 year old, 12 year old and me) stayed in an Executive room with two double beds on the 4th floor overlooking the lobby. We were met at our cab by the doorman as soon as we arrived and never touched the doors the entire time we were there â€“ not matter how late or early we left or arrived. The doormen were always friendly and kind to all of us. The lobby was amazing! The atrium was spacious and inviting, the Atrium Bar was accessible and a great place for people watching and peaceful - with someone playing the piano in the evenings every day we were there. The concierge smiled and approached us if we slowed down too much to ask if there was anything they could do for us. Everything was sumptuous and classy and beautiful â€“ a perfect entrÃ©e to Paris â€“ especially for our two impressionable little girls. Our room was spacious and big enough for us to store all of our luggage and we had enough room to move around comfortably. The bathroom was to die for â€“ huge with a separate, glassed-in shower with rain shower head. The tub also had a separate shower head. There were two trash cans, a scale (necessary after all of the croissants!) and every toiletry you can think of. We had four robes and four sets of slippers that were replenished as we used them every day and the turn down service was lovely â€“ especially the Godiva chocolates that were left every night. Our shoes were even arranged every morning when the beds were made and the room cleaned. The location was PERFECT! We shopped at the Monoprix about 20 yards away for snacks and a teapot and â€˜stuffâ€™. We bought our Museum passes at the FNAC 20 yards away in the other direction. We had our choice of the Franklin Roosevelt Metro stop 50 yards one way or George V 50 yards in the other direction. OR we could walk about 4 blocks, past the lovely shops on the Champs-Elysees, to the Charles de Gaulle Etoile Metro stop right at the Arc de Triomphe. We walked to the Brioche Doree or Paulâ€™s 15 yards away for a lovely breakfast, lunch or snack every day. We especially loved being able to walk out of the door into the fashionista crowds strolling the Champs. We stayed on points, but I would have paid for the best hotel in the best location in the best city in the world. We had a fantastic dinner in the hotel one night and ordered breakfast in one morning â€“ both meals worthy of being served in Paris. This is long, but the hotel was too, too fabulous! We travel a lot, so expensive is relative, but the convenience and service cannot be matched. We will definitely stay here the next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms and modern bathrooms in Central Paris”
Reviews.Author: rammenon
Reviews.Content: This Marriot a few blocks down from the Arc De Triomphe is kind of hidden with a small entrance. The lobby offers the normal baroque interior of a european downtown hotel. However for folks used to small bedrooms and older plumbing in Europe, the bedrooms here are excellent. There really is a "kingsize" bed with room to walk around and a very modern bathroom and all the normal amenities you expect Stateside. The breakfast is good, though expensive. The location needless to say is the best part. Walk out and you hit the crowds and its easy to get a taxi. Or just walk up to the coffe shop a few blocks up. Overall excellent modern hotel. Only issue: the price varies tremendously based on season and month/week, and I have stayed here at prices that vary almost 200% depending on the season and time of the week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: USTraveler12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in September 2009. The location is perfect, right on Champs-Elysees. Our room was small but it was clean and had modern furnishings. The big window of the room looked right into the lobby and since it was just a floor above the lobby, we had to close the curtains all the time. So in that sense, there wasn't any good view from our room. On the other hand, the concierge was very helpful, recommended us some really great restaurants and made dinner reservations for us. It is a typical 5-star Marriott hotel with modern decor, so if you're looking a hotel with french charms, then it might not be for you. Otherwise, it's a good one. We would return to this hotel if we decide to go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Professional Service & Very Welcoming..”
Reviews.Author: nrf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Marriott Champs Elysees Dec 26 2009 through Jan 4 2010. Check-in was easy, doormen very helpful (in fact during the entire 10 day visit, we only had to open our own door once!) Location is good (along the very decorated Champs Elysees & close to the Christmas market). Rooms are very comfortable the gym and sauna were uncrowded. The hotel has an elegant feel. The only complaint that we have is the cost of the internet connection - outrageous! Using the business center the cost would be $10-$13 per hour and in-room it was appx $25/day

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel right in the middle of things - but only on Marriott points”
Reviews.Author: tankycmg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights with my boyfriend using his heard earned Marriott points. It was my Christmas gift, so I wanted a place right in the thick of the city, and this spot was excellent. The rooms were big and roomy, as was the bathroom - very luxurious. Staff was very friendly but polite, but got us into our room by 10:30am after we arrived via the red-eye from JFK. Never tried the restaurant in the hotel since there are so many authentic spots right outside the door. We stopped by Paul and the Brioche spot just outside the door for our authentic breakfast and tiny coffees every morning. The kingsized bed was huge and so comfortable after walking 5 miles a day all over the city. And our view out the window of Sacre Couer off in the distance was lovely foreshadowing to our final day in town wandering around Montmartre. Only complaint is our wine glasses were not replaced after we used them our second night there, but then again, we didn't make a formal request for them. This was a lovely oasis to return to every day after wandering all over the city. We'd never stay here without the Marriott points, but were thrilled to splurge and use up a huge bunch of them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: LRPMGP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 nights at this awesome hotel to celebrate my 50th birthday. It was our first time to Paris and we loved the great location. Our room with King size bed was larger than expected and similar in size to US properties. Fixtures and furniture were modern and clean. I travel a lot on business in the US and found this property to be just what we hoped for. The concierge was very helpful with setting up dinner reservations at some phenominal restaurants, in some cases, getting us in last minute. We can say enough great things. Our room was so quiet and dark that are biggest problem was sleeping too late each morning. Pefect!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott ... it's vanilla, but safe.”
Reviews.Author: benyc
Reviews.Content: Marriott's are a bit cookie-cutter, but sometimes you need that depending on your traveling companions. The decor was a 'pretty' if a bit over-the-top gauche a la Marriott in Paris (if you know what I mean). Service lacked that soul. Nothing surprising. Went to Paris that time for the city and so the hotel was less important.

Reviews.Title: “expensive but it worth”
Reviews.Author: mcvyger
Reviews.Content: One of the most expensive Marriott I've stayed in. But this one is on the "plus belle avenue du monde" ("most beautifull street of the world" - according to french people). So sometimes with your 'cherie", why not... A lot of people in the street but the hotel is not noisy at all. The breakfast has the usual Marriott quality - I've sometimes complained about the croissants in some hotels, but this time of course I will not : real french croissants :) The room was nice and the team rather efficient.

Reviews.Title: “J'adore Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: mjs100
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is pretty perfect, as it is on the Champs-Elysees! It is a great starting point for getting around the city, although most places you will need to use the subway/cab system to get around. You can walk to the Eiffel Tower (20 minutes) or the Louvre (25 minutes) if you like to walk. The Champs-Elysees is beautiful, but very pricey... you can find much better and less expensive restaurants by venturing off of the strip. The hotel itself is beautiful, although it was undergoing major renovation when we went, which covered the entire front of the building with scaffolding. Overall, great stay i Paris... next time would like to stay somewhere more local. We enjoyed the stay in Paris... it is my favorite city in the world! It was a great time to visit, as it is the off season for tourism. We did not have to wait in lines at museums or anything, and the weather was mild. Visit Versailles if you have a chance. The palace is wonderful and the town of Versailles is very quaint.

Reviews.Title: “A bouncer instead of concierge”
Reviews.Author: fredericShanghai
Reviews.Content: I do think the Marriott in Champs-Ã©lysÃ©e is a high standard hotel. Neverthless, when I arrived, a front office agent (should be a concierge or guest relation) stoped me. Without any greeting, he directly asked my room number. I was very hurry because I needed to use the Business Center. Actually I was an outside guest so I did not have any room number. The guy (should be a foreigner I think looking like a Russian) told me strictly that I could not enter this area and the business center is reserved to the in house guest only. He did'nt even take the time to help me to find an other one near to the hotel. Just took me back to the door. I really think this people is not a good representative of Marriott approach to hospitality. It is very sad, for such a good hotel with that location, which is supposed to represent the French lifestyle to hospitality to greet people that way. I hope the next time I will go to your hotel (even if it is only for dinner) I could get a better welcome. Let just the bouncer know (which is posted at the entrance) that it could have been any important guest, and whatever the purpose of the visit, everybody should receive some good greetings, let's say, at least a smile.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place to stay...comfortable, convenient, luxury.”
Reviews.Author: PE1968
Reviews.Content: I spent my first night in Paris at this hotel and what a great beginning. From the moment I walked in the door, it was luxury and comfort. The location can't be beat...it's very close to the metro stop, Champs-Elysees restaurants and stores are abundant and the arc is just a few blocks away. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice...But Know what you are Getting”
Reviews.Author: Fandangophil
Reviews.Content: This was our Thanksgiving Hotel. I had two rooms and both were very clean, new and well appointed. My only wanring is to not be deceived by the room sizes in the Marriott web write up. Our "executive" level room was nowhere near the size indicated in the Marriott website (450 sq ft.+) so we felt deceived. AT BEST it was 300 sq. ft. The front desk supervisor assured us it was an executive room and the sizes "ranged up" to the 450+sq. ft.size. Since we had 4 people in one room we requested a bigger executive room, got it but it was still not up to the size in the website....maybe 330sq. ft. In fact the photo of the deluxe room on the website was EXACTLY the photo of our first executive room. The front desk indicated that the location also went into the decision as to what was a deluxe and what was an executive designated room. So much for full disclosure... Just wish they would be more forthrite in their write up. it is a beautiful place and very well located in Paris. Might stay here again. IT IS EXPENSIVE...Internet is about $30 USD a day.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Sophie2604
Reviews.Content: Well I'm sorry I like to write good reviews of hotels especially Marriott ones as I am a Platinum member but this hotel was very disappointing. Check in and reception was very disappointing, bar service was non existent and you had to do everything yourself. The bedroom was a nice size, apparently an upgrade and the rooms were quiet but the shower had not been cleaned properly and the soap and shower gel had been used. There was no atmosphere in the hotel although I did like the concierges. The hotel is centrally located but it was far too crowded and not a particularly nice location. On reflection I think the Renaissance Vendome would have been just as central and a little bit more Parisian. This hotel is expensive to be this mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location - and very nice decor!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelFamily11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott on Champ-Elysees on this most recent occasion to Paris, had stayed at several other locations in the past couple month and by far this is the very best location you can get in the city. I will come back because of its central location. It is close to museums, shopping , restaurants, etc and it's on the main Metro line with two stations within a couple blocks and the hop on hop off bus right out side the front door. I also find it is very clean and staff are friendly and helpful. You have to pay for WiFi but the connection is great which is useful if you are in Paris for work, there is not an Executive lounge which is the only draw back. The rooms/bathrooms were a very larger for Paris standards, and the room had a ton of extra space set aside for suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: stuartputnam
Reviews.Content: Walk to anywhere ... great shopping and great restaurants right outside the front entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but very busy area”
Reviews.Author: MarriottGuySanDiego
Reviews.Content: I'll start this off by saying my wife and I stayed seven nights at this property on points, so I find it hard to complain about anything (as should anyone who uses points, in my opinion). Anyway, very nice hotel, amazing breakfast (Platinum perk, though spendy otherwise). The rooms are smallish and the ones with a view of the C-E are being renovated. Close to the FDR stop on the Metro, short walk. The C-E, as you might expect, is VERY busy, tons of people, expensive everything. Toward the end of our stay, it got a little tired. If I went again, I would stay somewhere else to try something new, quieter. Discovered a grocery store in the basement of the Monoprix on the corner next to the hotel, which is good for snacks, water, pop, whatever. Again, very nice property, and with the Metro, you're close to everything. The staff was amazing and very helpful. Internet is $12 Euro for an hour, which you can divide up over your stay. Not great, not terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NeuroAngiodoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed a single night in April 2009 for business. Enjoyed this hotel and had a wonderful location, very easy walking distance to many of the key sites. Rooms were small which were fine for a solo traveller, but would have been disappointed if travelling with my family. I agree with the previous post about being loud at night. Entire staff spoke English which helped in me getting proper directions and getting restaurant reservations. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel If you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: loyalty_vip
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Marriott Champs Elysees in 2003 for my honeymoon. I have noticed that it has been renewed. I liked the new decoration it was luxury modern style. I liked the flowers arrangements in the lobby, and the complementary tea and coffee every day from 6 to 8 a.m. We have stayed in a deluxe room "very small room" in comparison to the price which was so high. The location is strategic and the service of the hotel was as expected in any five stars hotel. I will summarize my observations as the following; - The handle of the bath tub should be replaced with a new one. "The metal piece of the bathtub was without a cover and it was looking ugly". -There was a small cut in the Curtin of the room. - Their oriental menu was not that good. I think they should do something about improving their oriental food taste. - they donâ€™t have water cattle in the room and when I asked the room service for it they said that they donâ€™t have any in the whole hotel that was weird because all the hotels I have been in outside France offers it. (4 and five stars hotels) !! - They have not makeup our room every night and i was not sure was it because of the timing? I once asked them to clean the carpet and they apologize that the cleaning service was not available any time! Above all, I have enjoyed my stay in the hotel and I would definitely choose it again if I had the opportunity to go Paris in the future. And I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a five star hotel in the heart of the Champs Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful public areas but small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: marvl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location only a few blocks from Arc D'Triomph and a Metro station. Public rooms are beaufiful. 'Guest rooms are modern but small. Hotel is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to feel like you're in NY stay here”
Reviews.Author: grlpwr
Reviews.Content: Of course that's not why i go to Paris. I stayed here at the tail end of a 3 week trip to france because i could use points. There's more english spoken here than at the hotels i stay in NY - and virtually all the guests are non-continental european. The desk staff were rude (wouldn't honor my "guarenteed" reservation room request - and offered no apology or anything to make up for it), the rooms were standard courtyard marriott. All in all, i would look at some of the other rated hotels in Paris. Champs is nice, but look down by the Ile if you're looking for a GOOD French experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, inconsistent service, overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Boscobel28
Reviews.Content: This Marriott needs to review its service- over 8 days, we found too many issues with the level of services- poor communications over dinner reservations made by front desk personnel, causing tables to be lost; rooms not cleaned until very late afternoon; room given out, not ready for occupancy; very overpriced breakfast offerings (go to Brioche Doree a few steps outside), etc. This was our third stay here in 5 years, and will be our last.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was perfect and wonderful service from the staff.”
Reviews.Author: pjb100
Reviews.Content: My 11-year old daughter and I just travelled to Paris for 5 days as part of a two week vacation in France. The city and the Marriott absolutely fulfilled all of our expectations. Paris is wonderful and the Marriott is the right hotel in the right location. It's in a perfect spot on the Champs-Elysees - easy walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe, the Place de la Concorde and Luxor Eygptian Obelisk; across the street and a half block down from the famous Laduree Patisserie (try the almond croissants!); adjacent to all kinds of great shops, restaurants, etc.; and close to the Eiffel Tower and other attractions. The hotel was a quiet oasis with a lovely lobby and the service was excellent. I've seen a few reviews on this website suggesting otherwise and I just have to say that our experience completely belied that. Concierge Omar could not have been nicer or more helpful, the staff at the desk and the door were delightful and the hostess at the restaurant went out of her way to be extremely pleasant to us each morning at the breakfast buffet, which by the way was excellent. Omar suggested Chez Andre as a restaurant, close by (walking distance) on Rue Marboef - we ended up eating there twice, the food was excellent and surprisingly reasonably priced. Our room was wonderful - great, comfy bed and comforter, CD docking station, flat-screen TV, great bathroom - not a great view, but who cares? Just walk outside for the amazing view up the Champs-Elysees with the Arc de Triomphe lit up at night, that's all the view you need! All in all, a great experience and we were very sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: mo1972
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at a Marriott whenever possible and was looking forward to staying at the Marriott Champs Elysees (as Paris was our 3rd stop in our Euro trip). Unfortunately, the reception staff were not friendly. The rooms and bathroom are large. The carpet had many stains. The used wine glasses were not changed for 2 days (changed because I've asked them to). To top it all, the concierge did not help me at all in finding coin shops cos he didn't know where to look, so when I've asked him if I can use the Yellow Pages, he told me to go and use the internet (he could have made a phone call!!). I think Marriott should send this guy to any of their 2,700+ hotels to learn what good service is. Also, check your bill carefully, I didn't use or consume anything in the hotel, yet at checkout there was a dinner charge for 63 Euros (including 10 Euros tip), of course it was cancelled.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: s00sie
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Staff excellent. Location is very central. Metro is great for getting around. Take lots of money!! Would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fabulous location, great service & beautiful flower arrangements”
Reviews.Author: annkr
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Marriott Champs-Elysees in May. The location was great for us, as we love to walk & wander around Paris. With the Metro so close, ( about a block away in either direction) we could always hop on for a ride back if rain poured down ( a couple of afternoons) or we wandered to exhaustion. We acutally only used a taxi twice, arriving and departing for the Air France bus to the airport. We found the book of ten tickets to be the more practical than purchasing a pass for the Metro. Our fourth floor room had everything we expected, and the view was of the patio area of the hotel restaurant, which was usually not in use due to the cool weather. We used the little refrigerator to store a few snacks, and as the items are automatically billed to the room when lifted off the weight sensitive shelf, we had a few charges result from squeezing a yogurt or cheese in. However, we let the desk know that we had not consumed those items, and they cheerfully removed the charges. ( we did not wait until the end of the week to check on this). Bathroom was fabulous. Great shower, luxurious tub, and towels replaced morning and evening. Godiva chocolates on the pillow always a nice touch. Very comfortable king bed. Morning coffee & tea in the lobby was appreciated. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, but chose a different patisserie most days. We did have dinner one night at "The Restaurant". We used a Marriott "Dinner for Two" certificate, though we only had three of the four courses (they only had dinner sized salads, although our waiter offered to have them create a small salad for me). It was a lovely dinner, if not as many exciting choices as some places, and would have been rather expensive without the certificate. (filet of sole, 45 euros) My husband said his foie gras was the best he'd ever had, my eggplant, mozzarella and tomato terrine was terrific, and the filet of sole and steak were good, as was dessert and coffee.
