As it was a rainy night, it was a perfect night to stay in and enjoy the hotel's restaurant. We walked our last evening to the Eiffel Tower to watch the sunset and the lighting of the tower. It was a spectacular blue sky day, and from the Trocadero, a festive way to say good bye to Paris. When we go back to Paris, we would stay here only if we had extra Marriott points. Although the Champs Elysees offers great people watching and shopping, it was really too crowded for us, so we often enjoyed more normal areas, finding Paris really crowded only at the most famous tourist stops such as Notre Dame or the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, loud at night”
Reviews.Author: as150005
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a fantastic Marriott. I received an upgraded room for my Platinum Premiere status, and it was beautiful with two levels. The rooms are pricey, I would not have stayed if I did not have points to spend. But the service was great, there was easy access to the subway, restaurants right out the door, and plenty of high-end shopping. The only issues I had were: 1) No executive lounge - You do, of course, get free breakfast, which is great. But I also like the executive lounges for free bottles of water, especially in Paris since it is ridiculously expensive on the street. I did find that the fitness center has lemon water available, which was very helpful. 2) We had a room overlooking Chapms-Elysees. This seemed very nice at first, but it is incredibly loud at night. Each of the three nights we were there, there were street performers (break-dancing crew) blaring Michael Jackson until 1am. Definitely request a room away from the street if this is an issue for you. The only advantage of being located here was that we were able to find a free WiFi connection from one of the neighboring businesses.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location, great value, big splurge”
Reviews.Author: brittGlendora_Ca
Reviews.Content: we were lucky we had a week here the end of may to the beginning of june 09. also, we used our marriott points which gave us a great deal for a few dollars for taxes and such. the location was a short walk to the arche de triomphe and either way to the metro station. we bought a weeks pass on the metro (you need a passport type photo)and it was well worth it (we did it before) and we avoided the cost of a car & hotel parking and driving and parking, etc. when we wanted to explore further we took a tour (be aware that you may not have as much time as you would like) but it does relieve the driver of the task and allows him/her to enjoy the scenery, too. there is certainly enough to entertain you for a week or more just seeing the sights of paris. we had spend 10 days in 02 with one of our exchange students, using the train & metro to come into the city and explore. this time we saw what we couldn't see last time and revisited things we enjoyed so much the last time. next time we will probably rent a car at the airport and go out in the countryside and make a grand circle around the country.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful if you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: Ambidextrous91
Reviews.Content: My fiancee likened Marriott's flagship Paris hotel to the Leaky Cauldron (for those of you who don't get this reference I suggest you read more Harry Potter). This simile is quite accurate - the entrance takes but a small area on Champs-Elysees, but from the stairs opens out a magical world of luxury. Within a few minutes we were settled into our executive room, which was large, spacious, and comfortable. There were also some fabulous touches, eg the TV had speakers in the bathroom, the lighting was subtle and ingenious. There is more to this hotel though than just nice surroundings. The service is a step above most other hotels, with all staff fluent in English. The food offering is also fantastic. The stumbling block for many of you reading this is likely to be the price. Rack rates start at an eye-watering 779 euros a night, for which you don't even get breakfast including (another 29 euros per person). Our room was another 40 on top - probably worth it if you can afford to stay at all. If you really feel rich, then try the presidential suite - a snip at 6000 euros every night (ouch). Of course, the best way to go is the way we did - work away from home for a year, and the spend the points you have gained to stay at the courtesy of Bill Marriott himself! Thanks Bill!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations and location!”
Reviews.Author: CJK50
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott for one week and had a wonderful stay. We loved the convenient location, within walking distance of many sights, and close to metro stops. The staff was always helpful and the room was clean, comfortable, and spacious. We faced the inner courtyard and heard no outside noise at all. My husband and I were very pleased, and would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: carribeandreams
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the Champs. We drove from south England; parked the car and never used it the rest of the trip. The metro stop is very close and we could walk to the Eiffel Tower. We opted for a larger room; it was spacious enough for a family of 4 and surprisingly quiet. The bed was comfortable enough....The staff/service was typical European...not meant in a bad way....just that Europeans and Americans are very different culterally. The hotel is a little pricey (about 4K for 4 days; that included a couple of room services) but the location can not be beat....especially since it was New Years.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nichols77
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Paris, we stayed at both the Marriott Champs-Elysees and the Westin. We split our hotels because we were using points at both. As far as location, the Westin was our favorite. But, as far as the hotel itself, it was Marriott. First of all, Marriott upgraded us to an executive suite which was simply incredible -- first class all the way. It was a huge suite -- bedroom with extremely comfortable kingsize bed, living area, 2 flat screen tvs, bar, and luxurious bathroom. I have found that Marriott will upgrade very easily if anything is available, unlike Starwood hotels (Sheraton, le Meridien, Westin) which want to charge you for the upgrade. I also thought the Marriott, while very classy, was not quite as "stuffy" as the Westin. Both hotels had lovely common areas and professional staff. In regard to location, I love anything opposite the Tuilleries Garden, which was the Westin. We would go out in the early evening and just relax in the garden, sometimes with a picnic. It is easy walking to the Louvre, Place de la Concorde, Place Vendome, Opera area, and the Seine. The Marriott is also in a great location right on the Champs Elysees between Round Point and the Arch. It is nice for strolling and easy walking to river cruises, shopping, and convenient to the metro. That said, the Champs Elysees isn't what it used to be. We saw an increased number of beggars and homeless persons and an increased amount of trash on the sidewalks. However, it is still nice for the evening (or daytime) stroll, with lots of cafes to sit and watch the hordes of people passing by. I think the folks at Marriott really do a nice job with their hotels. I like the chain and I loved our stay at the Marriott Champs Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: WBMart
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location if you want to be right on the Champs-Elysees. The hotel is well kept and nicely designed, but has the feel of most Marriott properties. I found the service to be in keeping with a hotel of this caliber and the staff was multi-lingual and very helpful. We had breakfast each morning at the hotel and found it to be good, but nothing exceptional. If you are looking for a stay that is more authentic Parisian, you should go somewhere else (less touristy). If you want a familiar place to stay while in Paris, the Marriott is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EllaTheExplorer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Champs Elysees for the first time with my fiancee. The location was amazing, you really can't get better than this! We arrived early, but weren't allowed to check in until 2pm, which was the downside, so we had to find something to do in bummed out clothes(we had just arrived via eurostar, they did hold our luggages for us until it was time to check in), so we went to the L'ouvre for about 3-4 hours. When we got to our room, we had a pretty ugly view of the next street over from Champs Elysees and they also placed us in a room right next to some construction that was going on in the hotel, they make us walk about for 4 hours and then to come back to a construction zone. They assured us the noise was going to stop at 4pm, which it did and they sent us a bottle of wine and chocolates to apologize for that, which was nice of them. Overall the stay was great, the room is okay as far as furnish-wise, the bathroom was nice. Oh, and concierge was helpful, they booked our tickets for Moulin Rouge and we actually had amazing seats even though we paid the standard price, not sure if they had anything to do with that or not...but I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in service, would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: PatrickSea
Reviews.Content: This having been my first trip to Paris, I was anxious to see whether or not the rumors were true as to how pleasant the local people are towards foreigners (especially Americans). I'm very happy to say that I found almost every Parisian I interacted with to be friendly and helpful, with the exception of the Marriott. This is really ironic since you expect your $800 hotel to go out of its way to make your stay enjoyable and to simply greet you in a friendly fashion. Perhaps it was because I had just arrived from the Park Hyatt in Milan - where the service was absolutely impeccable - and the contrast was dramatic, but the service and friendliness of the staff here at the Marriott was awful. Really, awful. I stay at Marriotts all over the world and this was without a doubt the worst experience I've ever had. The front door man never smiles and might be saying Bonjour under his breath but I can't tell. The concierge, who is supposed to be the best at making you happy and meeting your needs, never smiled and wouldn't acknowledge you when you walked to the counter - he'd just look at you until you'd speak. Same experience checking in. It may seem blown out of proportion but it simply wasn't fun to go back to the hotel. It felt like they didn't want you there. As for the room itself, it was a standard American size hotel room and it looked just like an American Marriott hotel room. It wasn't anything special and nothing about the hotel justifies the cost, besides of course the fact you're right on Champs-Elysees with a very short walk to the Arc de Triomphe, restaurants, shopping, etc. I definitely won't be staying here next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “paris”
Reviews.Author: bframroze
Reviews.Content: A nice little hotel with a great location and very nice breakfast. Rooms were a bit cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Third time to Marriott Hotel Champs-Elysees”
Reviews.Author: RobReno
Reviews.Content: Rooms are better and bigger than in past visits. We were celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary, and treated royally. We were escorted to our room, and given Champaign and cake. Hotel is in great location â€“ sights, Metro, shopping, restaurants, etc. Itâ€™s more a Marriott than a charming Paris hotel â€“ thatâ€™s good after a month in Europe. Only suggestion is to teach the doorman to smile. My wife even kidded him and he would not smile â€“ French. My wife didn't bring her camera battery charger, so I asked it they had one. They looked through the lost and found and came up with an identical one. She too another 200+ pictures. Some other things did not go as well as expected during this trip to Paris, but the Marriott sure thing made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Champs Elysee Marriott Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mollie57
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and the service was impeccable. However, it is on the Champs Elysee and very expensive. We have Marriott Points so 1 of our 2 rooms was free. The breakfast left a lot to be desired. However you are in a great location to find somewhere else to eat. We went to the famous macaroon shop which has an attached restaurant which is close by. The name is escaping me right now but it's light green on the outside and beautiful on the inside. It was easy to catch the metro or just walk around. We later moved near the opera to the Hotel Edouard VII which was much quainter and less expensive but very nice. Great breakfast and great location to walk to the opera house, and the shopping district. Even walked to the Louvre from there. Galeries Lafayette was decorated for Christmas - beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Starlight36
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely well-located if you do mind the hustle and bustle of the Champs-ElysÃ©es. However, once inside the hotel it is calm and quietly efficient. Considering that I arrived at 8:00 AM, Reception was gracious and gave me a room as soon as one became available. Meanwhile, I went into the dining room for buffet breakfast. My room was absolutely beautiful, large, well furnished, immaculate, comfortable. quiet. The marble bathroom was huge with a separate stall shower, which was easy to operate and it was easy to control the water temperature, no small feat at some hotels. The stall shower was big enough for two! And, of course, there was a large tub. There were lots of towels and a clean robe each day; lots of toiletries were provided and replenished as you used them. There was turn-down service with chocolates. Of course, I might not be as enthusiastic about the hotel if I had been paying the going rate. I stayed 5 nights on points. Additionally, if you are looking for a typical French hotel, this property is very American. Also, you have to request the International Herald Tribune; otherwise, they leave US News on your door knob each day. At 29â‚¬ buffet breafast is expensive, unless you want to stuff yourself with all kinds of eggs made to order including omellettes, a great assortment of cheese, cold cuts, yogurts, bacon, sausage, potatoes, waffles, pancakes, smoothies, rolls, pastries, cereals, dried fruits, fresh fruits. The selection of fresh fruit could have been more substantial.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel But Beware of Ongoing Repairs/Construction”
Reviews.Author: edsatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel April 2 - 8, 2009 (me, my husband and 14 yr. old daughter) in one of the larger Executive rooms (since you cannot put 2 people in a standard room), which when we booked it using Marriott points, required an extra 85 Euros per night upgrade fee). Had not stayed at hotel previously. Simply a great location to be right in the midst of everything going on 24/7 on the Champs-Elysee (if you are looking for quite, this is not the place, but it is a wonderful base point for sight-seeing, shopping, restaurants, metro, etc.). The room and staff were wonderful. However - one big word of caution. Usually if there is ongoing construction you will see a notation on the hotel page on the Marriott website. Nothing for this hotel was noted before we left on our trip. Upon arrival, we checked in and no one said anything about repairs/construction, we were given a room on the 5th floor. When we got in the elevator to go up to our room, there was a tiny piece of paper taped above the elevator buttons saying that there was ongoing repairs and construction that would be taking place between the hours of 10 am and 5 pm. What an understatement. The next morning, 7:10 am, I felt like I was in the middle of a demolition site - surrounded on three sides by sledgehammers, drills, metal scafolding, etc. Complained at front desk and was assured they "would take care of it right away" and make sure it did not happen again. No go. Kept happening. Ultimately, on day 4, we complained again, quite vocally (and we noticed that the person at the counter in the line next to us was also raising a stink about the same thing). Bottom line, they did not move us, but waived the extra 85 Euros per night upgrade fee. Possibly because my husband is a Platinum member of the Marriott rewards programs, but also because no one wants to use 200,000 points plus pay 85 Euros per night for this kind of nonsense.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location beautiful common areas”
Reviews.Author: iqq
Reviews.Content: Stayed with Reward points in executive roon with 2 queen beds. Location is unbeatable and hotel common areas reflect a 5 star quality. Room quality is 4 stars really, little dated and not 100% well kept, but cannot beat size of room in such a centrally located place. Breakfast service was rather average/poor though, and the quality mediocre. That was a disappointment but could not complain since kids 12 and under eat for free. Definitely recommended but provided you get a reasonable price. I have seen this hotel price at 370-500 Euros and definitely do not think is worth that much. No way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for Exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: Brumjam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location for exploring Paris by foot, being smack bang on the Champs Elysees. Given the city centre location the bedrooms are of a reasonable size - certainly not massive but big enough and with excellent beds. Our room over-looked the foyer which can sometimes mean the room is poorly ventilated but in our room the A/C was excellent...whisper quiet as well. We certainly couldn't hear any noise whatsoever from the foyer which was two floors below. One word of caution and perhaps not much of a surprise, but eating in the hotel is very expensive. Budget on spending 30 euros per person for breakfast and even more for lunch and dinner. Drinks are also very expensive - 10 euros for a hot chocolate for example. The hotel staff are very friendly and overall I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helped me out at short notice”
Reviews.Author: alexkorf
Reviews.Content: After escaping from one ot the worst hotels in Paris, had to quickly find a place to rest my head. Called Marriott and never regretted it. Staff kept a room for me for a couple of hours without asking for a credit card number. They could have easily taken advantage of my situation and asked more for the room, but they charged the standard rate. It wasn't cheap, but wasn't extortionate either. When I finally made it to the front door they gave me an upgrade to a junior suite. It was large, clean, modern and even had an iPod dock. Next time I'm in Paris I'm staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but kind of worth the money?”
Reviews.Author: Sheridan2867
Reviews.Content: I rated this hotel excellent because though the location may not be my cup of tea, I'm sure most people would love to stay here. I stayed in Paris for 10 days in November 08 and spent about 5 days at the Mariott Champs Elysees. (I stayed in a different part of Paris for the first 5 days; I also wrote a review of the other Mariott hotel) First, let me start by saying this place is not for the economical traveller unless perhaps they are redeeming Marriot points (that's what we had to do in order to afford this place) or they just won the lottery. However, this hotel does not disappoint in terms of service, amenities, cleanliness and location. AND the breakfast buffet was great here, too. Actually, to be honest food in Paris is great everywhere you go. They take great pride in preparing food so I don't ever rememeber having a bad meal the whole time I was there. The hotel is situated right in the heart of the Champs Elysees; a couple of blocks from the Arc de Triumph and about a 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. There are restaurants and stores lining the street and the crowds just don't stop--ALL day, ALL night. I lived in Manhattan for five years and let me tell you; it's got nothing on Paris in terms of tourist and local traffic alike. When you walk out of the front door of the hotel, you are bombarded by the traffic. It got on my nerves a little bit but that's just me. If you like the hustle and bustle, there is no better hotel to stay in Paris. Actually, the Mariott is the only hotel located directly on the Champs Elysees. The staff is very friendly and speak perfect English so nothing get's lost in translation. During our time there, it was my Aunt's birthday so the staff sent up wine and cheese and a lovely piece of cake with a birthday note. Very thoughtful! We were impressed. A piece of advice: Don't dine on this street. The restaurants are super expensive and rather Americanized. So are the stores. The only good experience we had was the restaurant called George V which is just a few blocks away from the hotel. The cuisine is authentic French and the service is awesome. However, this was one of our most expensive meals during our entire trip. I think my tea came to $9 Canadian after conversion! LOL Most expensive tea I ever had. One more piece of advice: If you want the absolute BEST pictures of Paris, head to Notre Dame and climb the bell tower. I can't even begin to explain how amazing the views are. DO NOT miss out on Notre Dame--put up with the crowds because it's worth it. Just try to go during the week as the weekends are ridiculously busy.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy full service hotel - everything went well”
Reviews.Author: PaulSEA1
Reviews.Content: This is a very nicely run full service hotel. The location is ideal on the Champs. The service is above average compared to US Marriotts and I'd say above average for other 5* European hotels. Everyting was clean and elegant. (Stars in Europe are awarded on objective criteria such as having mini-bar, room service, TV, shoe shine machine. The stars don't tell you how nice a hotel is, just how many ammenties it has.) There is no exectutive lounge so the free elite breakfast is in the main breakfast room. It's quite nice for free - super expensive - 30 Euros if I remember correctly. It's mostly a continental breakfast with a few warm items for the Americans. Other extrals like internet were also priced at amputation rates. Your left thumb could buy you 24 hours of internet. The hotel has smoking floors but our room one floor away was not impacted by the smoke. This is a big plus in my book. The business center was very friendly about loaning us an umbrella each day. I'd give it two thumbs up but I only have one left...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great people”
Reviews.Author: paradisefoundDuck
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 fabulous nights at this hotel. Every one of the staff that we encountered was friendly, helpful and willing to go the extra mile to insure we had a pleasant Paris experience. The location is fantastic. You are a 15-minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe and the Louve museum. The Hotel is right on Champs-Elysees, which is the main street in Paris. Great restaurants and the trendiest of shops surround the hotel. There is a taxi stop and metro stop in front of the hotel, which is convenient for a visit to Ann Franks House, the Orsay museum and Versailles. Definitely visit the Eiffel Tower at night, lit up it is spectacular. I would definitely purchase a museum pass as it eliminates waiting in line. The breakfast at the hotel is great but a little pricey at 29 euros. For a walk in the park, stop by Paulâ€™s, about a block from the hotel, and pickup a couple of sandwiches and drinks and have a picnic. We ate at a lot of small local restaurants in different parts of the city and were not disappointed. Make sure you take the time to have a glass of wine or coffee in one of the street cafes and people watch.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Southpawfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week using Marriott points (Oct. 17-24) so we were more interested in location than "over the top" customer service. We have stayed at many Marriott's around the world and this one seemed to be on par with what you would or should expect from a Marriott. Very pleasant staff, clean hotel...average room. Our stay included the breakfast buffet each morning which was a great way to start our day. It was excellent. Marriott award stays usually get you the basic room which is what we had. Taxi cost one way from CDG to the Marriott was only 40 Euros. Less than what I had seen reported on other websites. We made extensive use of the Metro. I decided to buy Metro tickets in the 10-pack instead of the unlimited one week visitor pass. It ended up costing less to do it that way. The previous reviewer complained that the bar was dead most of the time. We actually found it plenty busy...but mostly with business people. Room service was prompt but seemed to always be missing something which they would promptly return with. It wasn't a big deal...after all, they are a lot better at speaking English than I am at speaking French. We spent the week seeing most of the main sites in Paris... and covering the city by Metro and on foot. The Marriott is positioned about in the middle between the Franklin D. Roosevelt Metro and the George V Metro station. I am happy to answer basic questions.

Reviews.Title: “not so great”
Reviews.Author: ranaho
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights, the 14th and the 15th of october , 2008 .. well let me put it this way .. we were diappointed and not as expected .. before coming to marriot we were in kempenski, bruges and intercont, amsterdam .. but the marriot was the worst stay of them all .. first they checked us in to a small gloomy room .. we requested they change the room, but ofcourse under the same category they are fully booked , so we upgraded .. in the other two hotels we stayed in , they always greeted us with complementary glasses fo champagne , bottels of evian water and chocolate .. well not the case in marriot.. for 2 days no one checked on us .. even when checking in no one accompannied us to the room , as if " go fetch your own room" . on our last day my husband was given a dirty towel by the maid .. and at 8 in the morning the door was opened while we were sleeping and another time on 10 .. i called the manager frustrated all she could say that we will send you a clean towel .. duh! she even frustrated me more .. they are really under the average of good customer services and next time surely i will not stay there .. maybe the four season will be a much better choice ..tMarriote are soo rude and surely not the best hotel to pay lots of money..

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Houziwang
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night in August. The hotel is ideally located on the Champs Elysees although it was quite hard to find (despite being dropped off by the taxi outside) as the entrance is literally just a door which seems to blend into its surroundings. On entering the 'secret' door a quick journey up the escalators reveals a fantastic atrium area with a domed glass ceiling stretching out several floors above you. The check in was seamless and the room was ideal for our short stay. There was only one minor occurence when someone tried to enter our room at 10:30 in the evening but were stopped by the chain on the door. This person was clearly staff and on asking the desk what was happening they suggested it was the room service coming to turn down the sheets. They would have had a problem doing this as we were inside them! We didn't eat in the hotel but the restaurant seemed to serve up standard Marriott fare. We also noticed that a large proportion of the guests seemed to be Middle Eastern and as such special menus were available in the bar area at breakfast time providing an exotic mix of eastern delicacies which may have made a nice change if we weren't so desparate to find a little Bistro somewhere in which to relax! Overall, a good hotel with a nice location and a room service team who don't wear watches!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: roamingprofessor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a superb location - central to everything - and is first class. The service was excellent - very friendly, helpful employees. We managed to get this hotel at an UNBELIEVABLY low price. No way would we be able to afford the regular rates. The American breakfast buffet was excellent but costly. Internet services were readily available 24 hours a day but costly. (How do people afford such expensive hotels?) Again, if you can afford it, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: wilso11
Reviews.Content: I I booked four rooms for three nights through the Marriott web site. I booked packages that included a gift on arrival & one massage for each room. On arrival at 3pm we were told the rooms are not ready, also our package we booked was no available, as there was no times left to get any massages. I asked could we then swap this for the breakfast package. I was told by the young man it should be ok, until a young female manager stepped in to tell us this was not possible. I told her when I booked on line there was ample packages available and why not? She then was unable to speak English. The young man said sorry & he will see what he could do. I was received a message on my phone the next day saying sorry, unable to change package. While waiting for our rooms to get ready, over 1hr wait, we decided to have a drink at the bar. We ordered three beers, two house wines & one coke. The bill for this was 76 Euros, about $140 US $. This was our first & last drink! This motel was full for the three days we stayed with at least 80% of the people who were staying there being Middle Eastern. It was quite evident this Motel mainly catered for Middle Eastern People, as the prices & service seem to reflect this. It was not a very comfortable stay. The hotel itself is a very nice building being in a good location with everything fairly close. The rooms are your standard Europe size, maybe a touch bigger then normal. They were clean & tidy with the bed being up to the Marriott standards. The door staff & the two young men at the reception desk were helpful & friendly. As for the others including the Concierge, they are not very friendly or helpful. These rooms were over $1â€™000 US a night & are defiantly not worth the money. Paris is a fairly easy place to get around and you donâ€™t need to waste this type of money on a room. You will need to walk regardless where you stay. You could get much more value & service for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Tourist Location & Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelWriter7
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Champs-Elysees is wonderfully situated for first-time visitors to Paris or those who prefer a hotel located in the heart of Paris. It bills itself as the only hotel actually on the Champs-Elysees. It is a 5 minute walk SE from the Arc de Triomphe and convenient to the Metro transit stop (FDRoosevelt). The hotel entrance is attractively tucked into a vintage facade, which could be passed-by if not for the doorman, flags and discreet Marriott signage. Inside, the lobby and reception area are modern with an atrium which rises to the upper floors. Our room faced out the rear of the building, onto a rather typical business street without a spectacular view. This may be desirable, however, as the street noise at the front of the building - along the Champs-Elysees - might be considerable. Our sleeping area, with king bed, was on a "loft" just a few steps up from the room entrance and desk area. The bathroom was modern and all furnishings were clean and functional. There was ample space to include a rollaway bed. Internet service is available for a daily fee. The hotel staff was VERY attentive. Our requests for extra blankets were filled immediately. The front desk clerks and concierge staff were friendly, never overburdened and always willing to please. They provided numerous tips for our travels which enhanced our stay in Paris. We only ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant, which consisted of an ample hot and cold buffet, with fruits, fresh breads/pastries and eggs cooked-to-order from an omelette chef. It was a relaxing start to our day. There are many fine dining options available nearby - and, of course, shopping options in every direction. Considering the weakness of the US dollar during our stay, it's difficult to determine the "value" of this hotel relative to others in Paris. Americans will certainly experience sticker shock at check-out. However, the Marriott Champs-Elysees provided us a luxurious experience, traveling as a family, that we would not have been able to receive if we had stayed at a smaller boutique property or a lesser-rated hotel. Keep in mind that we were not looking for a romantic, couples-only hotel. We were very pleased with this hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: itsaboutthepeople
Reviews.Content: Very nice, spacious room. For some, this would be the perfect hotel. Because of its location on the Champs des Elysees, proximity to several sites of interest and in the midst of a shopping district, you are immediately surrounded by tourists the moment you step onto the street. The hotel in general is very nice, the staff friendly, and the amenities plentiful (and quite "Americanized").

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay.. Very Very busy area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Error_Repair
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms/4 people for 7 days. May 25th to June 1st. We had a wonderful stay. The hotel is super nice and the service is second to none. If your looking for the true Paris feel I would not stay at this hotel. The area is overrun with tourists. I would recommend the "Latin Quarter". But if your looking to stay in an area rich in shopping and for people watching then this is your hotel. Lots of nice cafes. 15 minute walk to the eiffell tower etc. Its a great location for exploring Paris. We ate breakfast every morning in the hotel. Great selection of food. Your will enjoy the hotel however it is priced on the higher side.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: pksolecki
Reviews.Content: It was our second stay here but we cheated a bit on this trip, since our six days in the Marriott was thanks to Marriott "points" and we did not have to pay the high room rate. Nonetheless, you cannot beat the location! Just a few steps from a Metro stop and dead center on the Champs Elysees, we walked or took the Metro everywhere. The rooms are a tad small but well maintained, and the staff extremely helpful, especially the concierge. It is a "classy" hotel and a quiet haven in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but a bit pricy”
Reviews.Author: BillT2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take a two day holiday in Paris while staying in Amsterdam and we chose this hotel due to its location. It is listed as the only hotel actually located on the Champs Elysses. In fact, we found several. The hotel was elegant in every respect and lived up to the Marriott line of superb service and quality accommodations. Unfortunately, as is often the case on vacation, we spent so little time in the hotel and or the room that it probably wasn't worth the expense. We never even took advantage of any of the dining facilities in the hotel as the nearby sidewalk cafes were way too inviting to pass up in this delightful tourist city. The rooms came equipped with five pillows per bed and pillow top mattresses which were a wonderful touch. The bathrooms had both a shower and a bathtub (separate) which was also a nice touch but the water pressure left a lot to be desired. All in all, no complaints but we probably wouldn't stay here again. Just too many nice hotels all in the same area and unless you're in Paris for some reason other than touristy, the hotel and the hotel room are both low on your list of things to do and see in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, in an Amazing location, in an AmazingCity”
Reviews.Author: Abubu10
Reviews.Content: We used our marriott points to stay at this hotel for 6 nights and 7 days. It was everything i imagined and more. The location is about a 15 min walk from the eiffle tower, a 5 min walk from the arc, and 2 mins to a metro. The hotel staff is AMAZING... they were very accomodating, all spoke english, and helped us with everything we needed (reservations, maps, advice, taxis, etc). Like the previous poster, we were also told breakfast was included, BUT we had no problems when we checked out, the breakfast had already been taken off... and I must say the breakfast was AWESOME. Veal sausage, omlettes to order, every kind of fruit imaginable, bacon, quiche, you name it, it was there... a little steep at 29E but if its free its well worth it. One gripe is that you have to pay for internet, its 10E for a one hour card, or 24E for a 24 hour card. If youre paying that much, i feel like internet should be included. Other than that everything about the hotel was perfect, and i would totally recommend it to everyone!! I absolutly loved our stay there, and if we went back, I would not hesitate to stay there again with more points. The hotel can defintely be expensive if paying standard room rates though.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Breakfast Scam”
Reviews.Author: SavvyNavigator
Reviews.Content: We used 90k Marriott Rewards points to book a 3-night stay here. We found the room to be large and spacious, which is not usually the norm for Paris. It seemed very, very American and lacked any sort of Parisian charm. But it was clean and the staff was generally helpful and courteous. Please be aware of the breakfast situation. The buffet costs 29 Euros per person, which is extremely expensive with the current US$. We were told that breakfast was included by someone on the relations manager desk, and when we repeatedly enquired about the policy were consistently told, "breakfast is included with your room." Had we known if was not included, we would have happily had cafe au lait and a croissant at a local cafe. But we blindly forged ahead and ate in the restaurant each morning. A red flag (that we probably should have not ignored) was that we were asked to sign guest checks each morning, but were assured that "the charges would be removed at checkout." Imagine our surprise at checkout when we were hit with a 174 Euro charge for 3 days of breakfasts for 2 guests! We disputed the charge and were given a very, very, very hard time by the desk clerk. Finally, after much debate, they agreed to remove the charges. But, the desk staff made us feel like we were criminals trying to cheat the system (which we were not). Savvy travelers, do not make this same mistake, and next time, we'd probably stay over on the Left Bank in a boutique hotel in a more residential neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Central location, not as nice as the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: TravelingRaider
Reviews.Content: Great if you want to be in the middle of everything, but we preferred the Renaissance Vendome better.

Reviews.Title: “Best location Ever”
Reviews.Author: lib88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our anniversary from Feb 13-21. We used all of my Marriott points saved up for over a year and it was worth every last one. Every aspect of this hotel was what you would expect from a hotel on the most expensive street in the world. We were treated like people paying for our room at every step. The staff was friendly and accommodating from the doorman, to the front desk, to the room service staff. Check in was great. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We got an early check in at 11:00 and while I did ask for a high room, and was on the 3rd floor of 7. The size of the room was more than we expected. I have stayed in hotels all over Europe and I am used to the smaller rooms. The front desk staff remembered our name and nationality all week and were more than accommodating. We took advantage of the breakfast buffet all week and the staff again did not disappoint. The only thing better was the food. The made to order omelets were a hit with the wife and I loved the pastries that are always better than anything found in America. The maid service was quick and good. Being our anniversary, we stayed in bed late and the room was always made at the first opportunity. They also provide turndown service and a fresh rose every night. I was so impressed with everything, I would pay the 400 Euro asking price on our next trip because of the location and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had enough points to stay longer!”
Reviews.Author: carmat
Reviews.Content: To preface this review, we used Marriott points for a 5-night stay. So the room rate not factoring in this review, this was an unforgetable stay. First and foremost, the staff & service were impeccible. Staff spoke perfect English and knew you by name from first time they met you. The breakfast buffet had an enormous range of options ranging from European style meats, cheeses, croissaints, & jams to more Americanized scrambled eggs, bacon, & sausage. Concierge was very helpful in arranging last minute reservations to authentic French cuisine and also re-organized rail reservations if needed. And the perfect location...short walk to Arc de Triomphe in one direction and Tuileries/Place de la Concorde/Louvre in the other direction. Again, if we had paid 5 nights at 600 Euro/night, this review may have not been so favorable.

Reviews.Title: “Only hotel directly on the Champs-Elysees”
Reviews.Author: CorruptedSanity
Reviews.Content: We spent our honey in Paris at the marriott from 10 march to 18 march 2007. Location: Simply excellent, right in the middle of the Champs-Elysees and the only hotel on the Champs-Elysees. Right next to all the shopping centers, cafes,restaurants and the Arc de Triumph. Hotel: Rather small, but its Europe not Dubai, so what more to expect. The lobby contains thier bar and cafe. Rooms: Also small but neat. Interior was clean but not really luxxurious. Our balcony faced the back side, so no real view. Service: Regular, nothing special. Breakfast Buffet: Excellent really. Chef cooks the omlette infront of you, plenty of good cheeeses to choose from, breads and desert. We would definitely return to the Marriott due to its prestegious locations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: olarrain
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience, everybody is helpful, the room and food excellent, the location can't better. I booked this hotel thru a Fundation auction, the package was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: lightgreenlion
Reviews.Content: all i could say about everything in this hotel TERRIBLE

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good service, but very expansive”
Reviews.Author: marcstrauch
Reviews.Content: The Mariott hotel is directly located at the Champs Elsysees. The entrance is rather small and almost hard to find, but once you reach the first floor with the reception and bar, the Mariott offers a great Atrium up to the highest floor. The service is good and the rooms are spacious, slightly above the 4 stars, I would say. Unfortunately, the breakfast room and the leisure club are under modernisation until end of Dec 6, 2007, therefore all food is served on the patio and a sport center outside can be used. The price is pretty high, a regular room is mentioned with 775 Euro, we paid in the end 290 Euro which is still a lot of money, especially when breakfast is 29 Euro on top and Internet for a day 15 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “High Marks for Marriott Champs-Elysesse”
Reviews.Author: imovemtns
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel as we do not, as a rule, stay at chain hotels. They couldn't guarantee us a non-smoking king when we made our reservation, so we wound up with a queen room the first night. The next day (with our approval) they moved all our luggage, while we were out sightseeing, to a non-smoking king room. Both rooms were wonderful. We overlooked the courtyard which was very quiet. I don't know about rooms facing the street. The beds are extremely comfortable, with duvets, lots of down pillows and high thread count sheets. Both our rooms were quite large, especially for Paris standards. Hotel staff was extemely friendly, professional and helpful, with directions and restaurant reservations. The location is right on the Champs-Elyseese in the middle of the shopping district within walking distance to several Metro and RER train stops, and the Arc du Triomphe and Place de la Concorde. Lots and lots of good restaurants for all budgets nearby, if you choose not to eat in the hotel restaurants. Champs-Elysesse is a very busy, high energy street all hours of the day and night. If you are looking for a quiet neighborhood place, this is not the neighborhood to look in. We paid with a combination of points and cash, and it was well worth it. The Avis car rental office is right out the back door of the hotel, and the hotel bellman delivered our bags to the Avis office when we checked out. All in all, a great experience. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “another great stay at the Paris Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Bobinepa
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at the Paris Marriott using points. There is really nothing with which I could find fault. The staff are very accommodating and willing to help. Our room was ready at 10:30 am. This time we were assigned a smaller room but it was very quiet and had a view of the courtyard which was pleasant. A converter is available for 6 Euros which is refundable when it is returned. Internet access is 15 Euros per day. The bedding was a good quality and housekeeping was very attentive and knew when to clean the room. They were never intrusive. We ate breakfast in the hotel twice during our stay. It is a buffet but with a chef who will make eggs to order. It was 29 Euros per person. My husband didn't care for it at all, but I did. The bar area is quite nice with a nice view of the Champs Elysees. It was nice to stop there before we went to bed some nights. The location is great. It's right on the #1 metro line which connects to every other line making transfers easy. Many buses stop within a block or so of the hotel. Some people feel it's too touristy, but it's nice to walk out the door of the hotel onto the most beautiful avenue in the world (at least in my opinion).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, superb breakfast, but rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: clairann2000
Reviews.Content: Request a no smoking floor (which still seems smoky) AND a quiet room since some overlook the busy street...in theory we had one king bed, but it was very narrow and not a US King for sure. Breakfast is amazing and became lunch with plastic baggies in hand...smoothies, cheeses, meats, omlett station, pastries, fruits, yoghurts, potatoes, crepes....totally huge and everything tasted wonderful ...absolutely the high point. Room was nice, but some days we had hand towels, some days none, some days we had face cloths galore then none, one day one robe disappeared....and a piece of tape stayed on the hall floor for most of the week...and the air con made a noise like a jet plane and room service trays lined the hall forever. Lights were burnt out when we arrived and the safe didn't work, but instantly they came and fixed them. Staff was very very accomodating. Were using points so we can not complain, had we been paying retail I would have been a bit disappointed. Location is perfect for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Really fabulous location and great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Florida.Girl.2006
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend last November and I loved it! I think the absolute best part was the breakfast. It is a huge breakfast selection and the food was so good. In Paris, I actually prefer to walk and grab a fresh croissant on the roads, but not while staying at this hotel. Marriott is known for having really comfortable beds and the bed here was no exception. If you are going to be walking a lot, this is a great location! Also, you are close to the subway system as well as the best shopping around.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: flyboy0681
Reviews.Content: After staying at several European Marriott's over the past 2 weeks (Germany, Austria & Czech Republic), I was looking forward to my last stop in Paris (June 29-July 2), , anticipating the grandest property of them all. Although the Paris Marriott is quite nice, my expectations were not entirely fulfilled. My wife and I had gotten very spoiled by the other Marriott's along the way because we had access to the Executive Lounges due to my Platinum status in the Marriott Rewards program. The Paris Marriott does NOT have an Executive Level nor lounge, although Gold and Platinum members are treated to the breakfast buffet in the restaurant each day (value is 30 Euros each). Our room (328), while nicely appointed, but small. The floors do not have ice machines and we had to call down each time we needed a bucket. The carpet was somewhat worn in the room but everything else was in perfect working order. The bathroom was large and decorated very nicely, although the showerhead was mounted "length-wise", so the curtain had to be drawn in order to take a shower, otherwise the spray would flood the bathroom (go figure). The A/C was long to cool off the room, which I thought was odd given the overall size of the area to be cooled. The bed was comfortable but a bit on the soft side, as opposed to the firm side here in the U.S. The hotel is right between two metro stations, Franklin D. Roosevelt and George V ( pronounced â€œJorg Sankâ€�). I preferred using the George V station because it seemed a tad bit closer. We made extensive use of the Metro and purchased a 3 day pass, which was well worth it. We did not have lunch or dinner in the restaurant but noted extremely high prices when viewing the menu. Expect to pay well over $100 for dinner for 2, although Iâ€™m sure it would be a great meal. The prices at the lobby bar were also very high. The hotel location is probably the best in all of Paris, but the Champs-Elysees is just like Times Square. It's extremely crowded and very noisy. Those that get a room overlooking the boulevard may have major problems with noise. Our room was tucked away overlooking the courtyard and was exposed to street noise when the window was open. Once closed, it was completely quiet. There are mini-bars in each room but be careful because just touching an item may trigger a charge. We did not purchase anything from the bar during our stay but used the bar to store drinks we bought on the outside. Just the placement of our items in the fridge triggered a few charges on our bill, which were immediately removed by staff with no questions asked. A physical inventory each day would be nice to prevent erroneous charges such as this. Be prepared to enter a smoke cloud when entering the lobby from the street. We had a non-smoking room. The only way to sit down to a computer is by purchasing time in the Business Center located in the lobby (I think internet access was 10-15 Euro's an hour). Right down the street at 66 Champs Elysees was an Internet center that cost 8 Euro's per hour. The hotel does not have a gift shop, but down the street, one block to the left (when exiting the lobby), is a store called Monoprix. The lower level has a well stocked grocery store. Housekeeping was good as was the front desk staff. The concierge's were very helpful and friendly. At no time did we experience any snobbery at all, each one of the staff were very friendly and spoke English fluently. Taxi fare to/from De Gaulle airport was exactly 40 Euros ($53.60) each way. Getting to the hotel by subway is a bit complicated and not convenient when traveling with heavy luggage due to very few escalators in the system, and some stations are very deep resulting in lots of stairs. Air France does run a bus service, but the stop is at the Arch de Triumph at Charles de Gaulle Etoile and is a hefty walk, and uphill. This property gets high marks from me but Iâ€™m not sure I would stay there again for a number of reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: janvier22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott on the Champs-Elysees this spring, using our Marriott points and found the hotel to be lovely and the hotel staff very helpful. I had expected noise but the hotel is constructed around an interior courtyard and the rooms were exceptionally quiet. The rooms were also very large by European standards. Location is superb. There is a fabulous breakfast buffet every morning. It was a delightful experience. The only drawback was the presence of smokers, especially cigar smokers, in the lobby, but that's to be expected in Europe (but things are slowly changing). They did ban smoking in the restaurant and no-smoking rooms were available.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott good and bad”
Reviews.Author: tvlworknfun
Reviews.Content: This property was centrally located and near the subway. I am a very loyal Marriott fan and had 2 rooms using anytime reward points. I admit I high expectations of Marriott based on years of wonderful experiences. This property didn't live up to those expectations. I called a couple of days in advance of my arrival and requested an early check in or at least a place to freshen up as we arrived around noon. When we arrived they told us to return in 1.5 hours to check in. We returned in 2 hours and they were very polite and apologetic but asked that we wait in the bar and have a drink while we waited another 30 minutes for our rooms. The drink was a nice gesture but a place to wash up would have been better. The rooms were ok nothing special. The breakfast was included and was good however the serivce was terrible. One morning I had to literally plead with someone to get me the check to sign. We were at the property 2 nights and upon checkout there were charges on the bill that we did not charge. In addition the breakfast charge for one day appeared and had to be removed. The concierge were friendly and somewhat helpful. Overall we sensed an attitude of we don't really need to provide good service because we have a fabulous location and everyone wants to stay here. I think in the future I will most like stay at one of the other Marriott properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great and wonderful Stay to Marriott Champs ElysÃ©es”
Reviews.Author: AngeloTaravella
Reviews.Content: We stayed to Marriott Paris Champs ElysÃ©es from 7 to 12 may 2007. Wonderful place, the lobby, the confortably and clean rooms. Me, my wife and our two children has choose this Hotel with Marriott Rewards. The room service excellent, breakfast unbelieveble for the food quality. In the room ,quite, no noise, beds excellent and anything. For the location is the top for holydays, the shops. You're sourrounded by the luxury and you ve got by metro Frankyn Roosvelt 100 mt in every place of City. We had our wonderful trip with cildren for go to Disneyland, where " the dreams beginning true" Good bye Paris and Marriott see you soon...

Reviews.Title: “Went in tired, came out refreshed. Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: timidtravelerUs
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 4 nights at this hotel. I admit I was a bit weary of travel when I checked in, but after 4 night here I was refreshed and ready to travel on!!! Friendly helpful staff greeted us, We got into Paris at 9am from a tiring overnight train from Rome. We went directly to hotel, not expecting to be able to check in, but hoping to drop off luggage. The staff was so helpful, taking those suitcases off our hands in nothing flat, Such a relief. We went out, did a little eating and sightseeing, and did get our room before noon. Location is wonderful This hotel is about 2 blocks from the Arc d'Triumph. Turn the other way and see to the Louvre. It is such a great and convenient location. A block or two from the best metro in the world!! Right on the Champs-Elysees, The rooms were large and spotless, beds very comfortable, bathroom nice with a big shower and bath. The staff was so helpful and not at all condescending. In fact, I felt very welcome in France. We ate in several restaurants off the George V. we just went around looking at menus until one met our fancy. All were great. We brought our morning pastries from Paul's ( a bakery with many outlets , I noticed) They were good, and easy to get. I would go into one of the shopping arcades in the morning and get fresh squeezed orange juice form a stand there. Internet access in the business center cost 12 euros for one hour or 24 for 24 hours. I was trying to save money and bought the 1 hour deal, which was penny wise pound foolish as I needed it longer. I recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cola5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our Marriott Rewards points, and we couldn't have been happier! It was the best of both worlds -- a familiar U.S. hotel with a European look and feel. The employees are French (and love for you to speak French with them), but they do speak English. The service is impeccable. The breakfast is unbelievable (everything from meats and cheeses to fruits to crepes to croissants and pastries to individually prepared eggs and omelettes.) Our room was a large corner one with a king-size bed and a beautiful white tile bath. We asked for foam pillows and an extra bathrobe, which were promptly provided. They even brought us complimentary afternoon dessert and champagne because it was my birthday! Not to mention the fact that we could walk out the front door onto the Champs Elysees, with shops, restaurants, and cafes everywhere and a metro stop only one block away. If the price is within your budget (or if you're using Marriott points), you can't go wrong here. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Amber88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is directly on Champ Elysees making it perfect for shopping. The hotel is sandwiched between a huge Sephora Pefume Shop on the left and a lovely cafÃ©/restaurant/pizzeria on the right. Along either side are several boutique shops, cafes, banks, cinemas and shops from Zara and Gap to Cartier and Louis Vuitton all within walking distance. The Arc de Troimphe is also walking distance from the hotel. The entrance to the hotel is simply the door which can be easily missed if driving past, the entrance leads to an escalator up to the main lobby which is tastefully decorated with plenty of seating, a piano, a bar and naturally the reception/ concierge desks. All the staff are multi-lingual and very polite, courteous and always happy to help. We stayed in a deluxe room, which was small although satisfactory, overlooking the lobby. The room was clean and tastefully decorated, the bed was comfortable with lots of pillows, there is a plasma TV and adequate storage. The bathroom was small and the shower curtain looked like it needed replacing, other than that it was fine and adequate. The hotel provided a turndown service leaving Godiva chocolates in our room which was a nice touch. The hotel is in a convenient and lively location, although we did not have any problems with noise or disturbance. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Winning Location, So-So Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spamstan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip. Loved the location. The hotel itself was strickly OK. My room overlooked the interior of the hotel and was comfortable enough. But it didn't seem like the higher end room I was paying for. Overall service was good. In fact my bag was delivered the day after I arrived and the bellman not only put it in my room while I was out, but stopped me as I walked to the elevator to tell me it had arrived. For the money one can do much better in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Almost, but just short...”
Reviews.Author: joeiii
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a GREAT location if you are new to Paris. I go to Paris several times a year and this is my first stay at the Marriott. The loby is wonderful and the staff was excellent. The concierge was very helpfull and I appreciates their attentiveness. My problems with the hotel are the variabilty in rooms, each room is slightly different (we tried several and they were VERY accomodating to move us) and for a hotel that is this expensive, I feel that it is almost pot luck which room you get. You can get a good sized room or a small one, a room on the back alley (pretty noisy), courtyard or facing the lobby (last two are the best option so ask for that). You also have to ask for non smoking as many foreigners stay here and if smoking bothers you, the smoking rooms can be very strong smelling. The rooms are well appointed but I felt for the money, it could have been a little higher end. It is a very nice hotel and all in all, we did enjoy our stay. I don't think you will be dissapointed if you stay here but if your paying the full price because of the hotel location and name recomendation, I would also look at the hotels around Place Vendome and Opera. The Intercontinental Opera is a excellent hotel for a smilar price as are the George V and for a more modern twist, the Rennaisance Vendome.

Reviews.Title: “What a Magical Week!”
Reviews.Author: MemberAnn
Reviews.Content: We used our points to stay here for a week to attend a wedding, and best of all the breakfast was included. Yes, the price is very expensive but you have to remember the location of the hotel. What we loved was that this was a European hotel, yes, the rooms are small but the service was impeccable. And I have to say thank goodness that the staff were trained American style in service- the customer is always right. And this is not the general attitude of other places such as Galerie Lafayette where you have to get in someone's face to get someone to help you. i loved this hotel because of the location, the service, and the small things that they did - the way the restaurant staff inquired daily about our excursions and how we liked them and one dinner waiter was so kind to want to wish us farewell at our final breakfast. This is a beautiful time of year to visit Paris, and the Marriott made it just magical for us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location! Not So Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gigii76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at some amazing luxury hotels in our travels and some not so luxury hotels. The Marriott Champs-Elysees was close but no cigar. They started our stay on the wrong foot by delaying our check in process by four hours. The front desk was trying to be as hospitable as possible but there was no excuse for not allowing us to check into our selected room until 7:00 pm at night at a rate of 570 EUROS per night. Now I don't want to come across as unfair like some other reviewers. The hotel is very beautiful and the room is nice for European standards; however it was just too small for the price. The location was top notch, with an array of restaurants and shopping at a walking distance. Aside from the fantastic shopping on the street, one cannot go to Paris and not visit the historic bakery Laduree. Laduree is practically across the street and it is famous for their excuisite Parisian Macaroon cookies as well as a menu full of sweet delights. I highly recommend the dessert called "Creme de Isphahan". The best part of staying at this location was the fact that the street is alive well even after midnight. It was great to do all the sight seeing activities during the day and know that the avenue would be open with shops and restaurants well into the night. The hotel staff was good about telling us about the shows (Lido/Moulin Roge). They also provided us with information about open/closing times and ticket prices. The truth of the matter is that we loved the location but the hotel itself was not worth the price. Last note: our breakfast was included in our room price and I have to say it was very nice with a nice selection to suit everyones palate.

Reviews.Title: “Paris' Finest - Location, Style & Service”
Reviews.Author: mktozd
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that I have stayed at the Marriott Paris and it really is a wonderful place. First off, the location is fantastic. Staying at the Marriott, you will be close to most tourist attractions and can even take a walk to the Eiffel Tower across the river if you like. Second, the rooms are fantastic. We had room towards the back of the hotel, but it was quite, had wonderful amenities and was a great place to come home to. Third, the service is fantastic. Every detail will be taken care in the best possible way. Staff is really great here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SiobhanXO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first few nights of our honeymoon, using Marriott Rewards Points. The hotel is in a great location right near the Arc de Triomphe and the FDR metro stop. The service at the hotel was wonderful and we were able to check in early for a much needed nap and shower before seeing the sights! The beds were probably the most comfortable I've stayed in and the bathroom was beautiful with a tub and shower. A great stay during a special trip!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: SD_Happy_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the first day of our honeymoon and had requested early check-in as our flight was arriving around 9am. When we got to the hotel, we were told our room would not yet be ready for 1 hour. We were able to leave our bags off at the hotel and take a quick walk to the Arc de Triomphe. When we got back, they more than made up for the delay by giving us a larger room than we booked, AND a room looking right onto the street. The room smelled a bit like old cigarette smoke, but it wasn't too bad. The room had really nice amenities and a large bathroom. The towels were super thin and smelled a bit funny, but otherwise, the room was wonderful and staff was very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, very comfy beds, very nice”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: To see a video of the room I stayed in copy and paste this link to it on youtube.com: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WGdrgU4nCsg I have stayed at this hotel around 4 times in the last 18 months. It is an expensive hotel to stay at as it is right on the very glamorous and main tourist street of the Champs Elysees. This has the Louvre right down at one end and the Arc Dâ€™Triomphe at the other. The prices at the Marriot do vary a huge deal over the course of the year based on when the major tourist season and major events, like Paris fashion week, take place. Overall the hotel is a very nice place to stay. However, it can be expensive with a room around 240 euros a night. I have always been staying there as I have been attending meetings being run at the hotel. The bedrooms are a good size, not huge but a decent size, and feature the fantastic Marriot beds, loads of pillows and comfy duvet. The beds are something that everyone who has not stayed at the hotel comment on. They almost all look out over the back of the building so have no real view. But they are very quiet as a result. The bathrooms are also pretty good with decent sized bath and separate shower. The mini bar is, like all mini bars, well stocked and costly. There is a large restaurant that is ok with breakfasts costing about 22 euros for Continental and 26 for American. This seems a lot, and so worth trying to get a bed and Breakfast rate if you are the breakfast type! There is a lobby bar with very friendly staff that is right in the middle of reception so alright for meeting people before heading out, but not suitable as a â€œdestinationâ€� bar. If you are at a meeting at the hotel, the problem is almost all of the meeting rooms are in the basement with no windows. The hotel is great for business as so well located, and takes around 15 â€“ 30 minutes by can to Eurostar based on the time of day. I am not sure that I would chose it if I was visiting Paris for vacation though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wenluvstravel
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel. The staff was very helpful; however, I did not feel that I had a truly French experience. The Champs as well as this hotel lacked French charm to me. I would only recommend this hotel if you have money to burn or if you're using your Marriott rewards points. I used Marriott rewards points so I don't have much to complain about but I would not stay at this hotel if I were paying for it. You can find better accomondations for the same price. During my recent trip to Paris, I stayed in the first arrondisement which was absolutely charming.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: heroic_gal
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel on the Champs-Elysees, and it was fabulous! It's close to the Metro, and the Arc de Triomphe is at the end of the road. The only downside was that our first hotel room had a very lumpy bed, but we changed rooms after the first night.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: sedch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect place to stay for first time visitors to Paris. The staff was wonderful, the rooms clean and beautiful and the location perfect! I can not say enough about our experience! Thank you Champs Elysee Marriott for making my first trip to Paris a true joy!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: modorolfo
Reviews.Content: i stayed for an entire week and really enjoyed it. The staff was very kind, willing to help you in any way. The breakfast was delicious. Everything was really clean, and propper, and the location canÂ´t be beaten!
