Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: LabsRule
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for 7 nights. If you must stay on the Champs Elysees, then this is probably a good option for you- if you don't mind the price and are a sound sleeper. However, if you want a quiet hotel, this may not be the one for you. Also, there is nothing impressive about the food or the rooms. This hotel is attended by a high proportion of Arabs and Americans. So, if you are an Arab American you will fit right in. I asked for a quiet room and we were put above the ballroom where on our first night a Wedding party rocked until 3:30am. We were assured that there were no other functions planned during our stay. The second night there was another party and we were up until 3:30am. We then got moved for the rest of our stay to the "most quiet spot" in the hotel. It was pretty quiet until our last night where there was a party going on next to us and a party above us and yelling in the courtyard. The rooms are clearly not very soundproofed. Overall, the service was good, the people were pleasant and language wasn't too much of a barrier. However, I was very surprised that they did nothing to make up for the inconvenience of the noise. Also, the concierge could only recommend one nice restaurant (L'Appert??) -which turned out to be just OK. We asked for alternatives and were told that was the only nicer one they knew of. Very odd. We found some very delicious restaurants on our own by walking towards George V. The room was a typical hotel room, nothing impressive - but we did have plenty of room for our clothes and it was nice to have AC after a hot day sight seeing. Note: the higher floors (6 and 7) are the smoking rooms. But again, if you really want to stay on the Champs Elysees and you are a sound sleeper, this is a good option. However, keep in mind with the metro system anywhere in Paris is a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “great location and service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had two adjoining rooms for 5 days for my wife two sons (9 and 11) and me. While I speak some french my family does not. I found the staff extremely helpful and attentive. They were all fluent in english and very courteous. The rooms wer also excellent. My experience was certainly different than those of the negative reviews on this site. I think the hotel is well located for most visitors--we walked to the eiffel tower, louvre and arc de triomphe. Metro is 2 blocks away. The restaurant is not much, but there are plenty of good restaurants nereby and the concierge is helpful. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can not beat location, Hotel is Great”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Lving
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 evenings on business, and would recommend this hotel for any traveler. MUCH nicer than standard Marriott fare (I am Marriott Gold) and competes with upper price hotels such as Inter-Continental and Ritz very well. The location is steps from the Arch de Triumph, and you can be the Champs Elysee by walking out the door. I walked to the Eiffel tower, and as far as the Louvre without any difficultly. I would take the Metro to Notre Dame. I never ate at the hotel...there are too many other great spots in Paris. Expect a stylish, clean room with exceptional service from the mostly bilingual staff. The only hotel on the Champs Elysee that I know of, and it is very nice. Don't worry about other reviews regarding cost...this entire city is expensive, and you are paying for service and locaiton here. Enjoy Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel & Location!”
Reviews.Author: mkhollis1
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel with great service & super location! It is in the middle of the Champs-Elysees, so everything was within an easy walk or quick metro ride (metro was about 1.5 blocks away). Many restaurants and shopping right at your door. The service was excellent, with everyone we came into contact wanting to be sure we had whatever we wanted. The bar in the lobby was smokey at times, but the service and food/drinks were good. The rooms were well appointed and seemed to be recently rennovated. The bath was very nice with separate shower & tub. The only complaint I can possibly muster is the towels are short, so they are a little odd (but not a big deal at all). We were in the back portion of the hotel, away from the street, so we had no issues with noise. I would highly recommend this hotel, and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel with mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: psydocnr
Reviews.Content: When we got out of the taxi no one came over to help us with our luggage. The lobby, however, is very pretty. it gave a wonderful first impression. Service in the restaurant was not good at all. For a cup of coffee we had to beg and for refills we begged more. A few of the concierge staff members were not very helpful at all. Some were better. The first night of our five night stay we did not have ANY bath towels at all. we had to dry ourselves with hand towels, no joke. This for 500.00 USD per night. the room was just a room. nothing special. The heallth club basically was one treadmill. Had we spent less per night i think it would have been a more pleasant experience. for the price it was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: gulch
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on visit to Paris. If you are an American coming to Paris, this hotel will be perfect at making you feel comfortable in a foreign city. Better than most Marriott properties, including JWs and Renaissances. Marble, chandlers and French provincial furnishings were abundant. Beds were very comfortable and bathrooms were nice too! Service was warm and friendly. Did we mention the location???? Walk down a couple of blocks to Monoprix, nearby grocery store, grab some Evian, French wine, cheese and a bagette and enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “So expensive and so ordinary”
Reviews.Author: hoteljunky
Reviews.Content: Wow, this would have been an OK place to stay for 150 euro but for 500+ it was completely wrong. Limited services for dining etc and poor food when it does arrive (how is this possible in paris?), small gym better seen in a holiday inn, and a conciere who not only fails to book the restaurant you asked for but then tells you it does not exist and does not offer any alternative, leaving you reservationless at 7.50pm when you expected to eat ay 8pm.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a 10.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights in the Marriott Champs-Elysee this summer and found everything to be perfect, making our Paris experience even more memorable. The hotel is gorgeous inside, the former address of Louis Vuitton, with a huge atrium and glass dome in the marble lobby. Security is good and you need your room key to operate the elevator. Our room was great, large, quiet, beautifully decorated, with a heavenly bed and down comforter, all cotton sheets and about 8 pillows. They provide turndown service with chocolates every night. There was a nice sized desk and chair and a big armchair to watch the big tv. The lighting was very good, which is important if you want to read. The bathroom was all white marble and huge with a separate bathtub and shower, fresh flowers every day, robe, magnifying makeup mirror for my wife, lots of towels and generous sized bath products. One of the best things is the location. We got off the Air France bus at the Arch de Triomphe and rolled our luggage a few blocks down the Champs-Elysee to the hotel. Almost next door is a wonderful bakery called Paul that opens early so you may pop down there in the morning to get coffee and rolls and bring them back to the room, if you care to. A block away is a Monoprix (large drugstore/grocery store) so it's an easy walk to get anything you need. There are tons of restaurants and shops in the area of every pricing , and the Metro at Franklin Delano Roosevelt is only a short walk away. Buses of all sorts stop almost right in front of the hotel. Of course we expected a touristy atmosphere on the most famous avenue in the world, but actually it's quite exciting and fun. We've stayed at the Grand Hotel and Westminster in the Opera section and others in the Marais and Eiffel Tower area but we thought this was the best. The staff couldn't have been more pleasant. They were all young, enthusiastic, friendly, eager to help in any way and spoke excellent English. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: 5startraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, beautiful, well kept and everything about staying at their hotel was pleasant. They accomodated us with last minute reservations and the entire experience was wonderful. The location can't be beat, the breakfast buffet was terrific. I don't know what rating this hotel has, but I will definitely stay there and will try out other Marriott Hotel's in the future! Because I did have such a wonderful experience, I almost forgot that it is important to put your do not disturb sign on your door as the maid's walk right in and at 8am! Twice, this happened on the same morning. They knock, as they walk into the room without a chance to respond and very early. Wireless Internet for $15/day in every room as well as in the business center with prepaid cards.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of May. I cannot say enough about the location. It's so amazing to step out the door onto the Champs Elysees. Plus, you feel very special that it's the only hotel on the strip. There are always tons of people around, even the wee hours of the morning, but you would never know as our room was very quiet. It is on 2 subway lines (good for the touristy stuff) which is fantastic. We also stayed here on points. I can't imagine anyone paying 775E which was the listed price. It was nice and all, but for that price I would expect high end luxury!

Reviews.Title: “No Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with wife and 8 month old doughther. The hotel was ok, but the only thing that was excellent was breakfast (should be at 25 euro per person). We paid around 450 euro a night - it was worth maybe 180. For that price you expect a nicer looking lobby, nicer rooms, better towels, bathrobes (not just one, if you are two - you should not have to complaint about such things) The gym was the worst I have seen, in a smal basement they had a few cheap machines. I didnÂ´t like the location, Champs-Elysees is realy touristy - the crowd at night-time is quite trashy. There is so may nice beautiful streets and areas in Paris so finding a better location is easy. If it woluld have been a cheap hotel offering five star service it would have been ok, but at the rates they charge, you can find much better places... Joje

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hello!
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in March, 2005. We were using our Marriott points and we owed nothing when we check out so that also enters into my opinion. We got there about 10am and were told that while we could have a non-smoking room immediately if we also wanted a king size bed that we would have to wait about 2 hours. We left our luggage and ran errands (metro and museum passes, breakfast, etc) When we came back our room was ready. It was the last room at the end of the hall. The bathroom was great and the bed was super comfortable. But when we tried to nap, there was construction going on that made it difficult. We were told that it was in the building next door and that they would try to move us. They never did, but the noise never happened again so it didn't matter. We found the staff helpful. The concierge confirmed dinner reservations for us and made new reservations as well. We asked for a late checkout on Sunday (1pm) and that was fine. Our only problem was getting a taxi at night. The security guard can't leave and spoke almost no English so we didn't realize that only the bellman could get a cab. The Marriott person for the time shares was in the lobby but my husband said he would have to check with me, and we managed to avoid the situation whenever we left. We had a great time at a very nice hotel. However, the price posted outside the hotel was 775 euros for a regular room. There is no way that I would ever pay that much, but using a points was a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Marriott product, marred by unhelpful, haughty front desk staff...”
Reviews.Author: sarahpartridge
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night last weekend. As a silver member of the Marriott Rewards programme, I am loyal to the brand, and will always choose the Marriott option if available when travelling throughout Europe. Therefore we always feel at home with Marriott as it is so familiar. It was therefore rather shocking to experience haughty, officious desk staff. I arrived at 4pm, only to be told that my room wasn't ready. I asked why this was the case and was advised that it was Sunday and there were a lot of late check-outs. Not my issue, I would have thought. I was told to take a seat and wait. I was not told how long to wait, nor was I offered any refreshment. I really wasn't happy. I waited 15 minutes watching others check in and receive room keys. I asked again. Again told to wait. 5 minutes later I said that I would have hoped to have been accomodated by now, this really wasn't good enough and may I speak with the Manager. I did, and he miraculously found me a room. It was tiny. I mean really tiny. Way smaller than I have ever seen in a Marriott (I should have guessed when he asked me if I was travelling alone). I rushed out of the hotel to run an urgent errand, and on my return asked for a more suitable accomodation. Another manager processed this for me and I was located in a decent sized double. Much better, as I had to spend all evening and a lot of the next day working. Ordered room service, and received an excellent response! Great tasting, beautifully presented, by warm and helpful staff. I was feeling right back at home with my Marriott experience. The location is good if you like the whole touristy, rip-off prices, Champs-Elysees thing. Personally I prefer Le Marais district or maybe the left bank when away on vacation in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has excellent location, friendly staff, and comfortable rooms. What more can you ask for?
